User 1: Oh , that's exciting . What does this guy look like ? Is he hot ?

User 1: It seems you two are a good match . What qualities do you look for in a friend ?

User 1: Well , that's something I've never heard of . But if you ask me what I value most in a friend , I would say honesty .
User 2: I agree . You can't expect a close relationship with a dishonest person . Those are the people that will turn their back on you when you are in need .
User 1: Yeah , I know . A friend in need is a friend indeed . I don't need fair-weather friends either .

User 2: Not much , except that my mother-in-law is driving me up the wall .
User 1: What's the problem ?
User 2: She loves to nit-pick and criticizes everything that I do . I can never do anything right when she's around .
User 1: For example ?
User 2: Well , last week I invited her over to dinner . My husband and I had no problem with the food , but if you listened to her , then it would seem like I fed her old meat and rotten vegetables . There's just nothing can please her .
User 1: No , I can't see that happening . I know you're a good cook and nothing like that would ever happen .
User 2: It's not just that . She also criticizes how we raise the kids .
User 1: My mother-in-law used to do the same thing to us . If it wasn't disciplining them enough , then we were disciplining them too much . She also complained about the food we fed them , the schools we sent them too , and everything else under the sun .
User 2: You said she used to ? How did you stop her ?
User 1: We basically sat her down and told her how we felt about her constant criticizing , and how we welcomed her advice but hoped she'd let us do our things . She understood , and now everything is a lot more peaceful .
User 2: That sounds like a good idea . I'll have to try that .

User 2: Sorry! The stretch for that octave is always hard to make.

User 1: Hey , Mike . You've been surfing the Net for quite a while . What on earth are you searching for ?
User 2: It's something relative hackers . I often hear people talking about them , but I don't know much about them .
User 1: Well , roughly speaking , a hacker is a computer buff .
User 2: You mean a guy using enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the computer ?
User 1: You can say that .
User 2: But why are people always having such a negative attitude towards them ?
User 1: They must have mixed hackers with crackers .
User 2: What is crackers then ?
User 1: There is another group of people who loudly call themselves hackers , but they aren't . They break into computers and break the phone system . Real hackers call these people crackers , and want nothing to do with them .
User 2: So they are two totally different concepts .
User 1: Well , the real hackers mostly think crackers are lazy , irresponsible and not very bright , and feel that being able to break security does make you a hacker any more than being able to start cars without keys makes you an automotive engineer . Unfortunately , many journalists and writers have been fooled into using the word hacker to describe crackers . This irritates real hackers to no end .
User 2: I see . Then the basic different is , hackers build things , crackers break them .
User 1: You got it .
User 2: Thanks a lot .
User 1: You are welcome .

User 2: Yeah , I'll call later to patch things up .

orig:
User 1: Get up as early as six o'clock only to be jammed at every crossroad and still late for work . What a life ! I've had enough of it .
User 2: Cool down , man . Everyone is fed up with the rush-hour traffic . But life isn't really all that . You should take the initiative and make some changes first .
User 1: What should I do then ?
User 2: I recommend you ride a bike instead of commuting by bus . It may offer you many benefits . First , it's good for your health . I'm afraid it's not necessary for me to further elaborate . While lots of people spend time like an hour each morning exercising , a bike ride to work not only builds you up , but also makes full use of time . You might as well sleep out for a longer hour .
User 1: I know cycling is always a more favorable choice than a bus . After all , it's a sport . But do you think it a pleasant experience to take in the dirty , polled air on the road ?
User 2: Well , such things are just unavoidable in a great metropolis like Beijing . I think a still more desirable benefit is psychological . Bicycling home after work can help release your stress . Life in the offices is miserable . You just sit there in a daze , gazing at the monitor and dealing with files and documents . Why don't you give a full play to your energy after work ? Enjoy the speed on the road . Just think , you are flashing past the poles with your own energy . How great !

User 1: Who was the best teacher that you ever had ?
User 2: That would have to be Miss Baymler , my fourth grade teacher .
User 1: What was she like ?
User 2: She was patient , kind , fun , smart , caring , and yet strict , too . I really learned a lot from her .
User 1: What kind of things did you learn ?
User 2: She taught us that you can do anything that you want to do .
User 1: Anything ? Do you really believe that we can do anything ?
User 2: If you really want to do something and you work hard at it , I believe you can do it .
User 1: You said she was strict . Did she have a lot of rules ?
User 2: She had some rules that helped us to feel comfortable . For example , the students had to treat each other with respect , or they would be disciplined .
User 1: I see . She sounds like she really cared about her students .
User 2: Yes . She treated us all fairly . She don ’ t have any teacher ’ s pets .
User 1: Really ? Doesn ’ t every teacher have a teacher ’ s pet ?

content:
User 1: Who was the best teacher that you ever had?
User 2: That would have to be Miss Baymler, my fourth grade teacher.
User 1: What was she like?
User 2: She was patient, kind, fun, smart, caring, and yet strict, too. I really learned a lot from her.
User 1: What kind of things did you learn?
User 2: She taught us that you can do anything that you want to do.
User 1: Anything? Do you really believe that we can do anything?
User 2: If you really want to do something and you work hard at it, I believe you can do it.
User 1: You said she was strict. Did she have a lot of rules?
User 2: She had some rules that helped us to feel comfortable. For example, the students had to treat each other with respect, or they would be disciplined.
User 1: I see. She sounds like she really cared about her students.
User 2: Yes. She treated us all fairly. She didn't have any teacher's pets.
User 1: Really? Doesn't every teacher have a teacher's pet?
User 2: Well. To be honest, I usually sucked up to teachers because I wanted them to give me good grades. However, Miss Baymler didn't treat me any differently. She really didn't have any teacher's pets.
User 1: Do you know what she is doing now?
User 2: As a matter of fact, I do. After she taught our class, she got married and moved to another city. Then, she started writing children's books.
User 1: Have you ever read one of the books?
User 2: Of course! Both children and adults enjoy her books.
User 1: Why don't you recommend one to me?
User 2: Ok! I'll bring one to you next time.

orig:
User 1: What is the most unexpected thing you experienced in space ?
User 2: I wasn't quite prepared for the view of the Earth as we left . It was just awe-inspiring . It emerged from just a slightly curved horizon to a whole Earth , where you could look across oceans and continents in a single glance . I wasn't quite prepared for that . It's inevitably etched in my memory .
User 1: When viewing the Earth from space , do you feel detached from humanity or more a part of the totality of humankind ?
User 2: Detached . You're literally detached from one planet , captured by another . Your only link to reality is the Earth out there ; fortunate - 1y , it stays in view the whole time .
User 1: There're a lot of suspicions that the International Space Station is never going to become reality . Is it going to be some future project that never happens ?
User 2: I believe it's certainly for real . It without question has suffered a lot of delays . But there's hardware sitting on the pad right now and it's due to go off in December . It is a reality . It has just taken longer to get literally off the ground .
User 1: There were a lot of talks during the Bush administration about a not too distant future Mars mission . It seemed to fizzle out . Do you think that this Shuttle mission will reignite the public's passion for space and get us to Mars sooner ?
User 2: I hope this flight is not just a one-time affair , that it does re-ignite people's interest to push on . But only time will tell .
User 1: You had gone to the moon twice , orbited space around the Earth lots of times , and of course you have had the most amazing views that a human being can have . How long do we ordinary beings have to wait to feel the weightlessness ? I just can't wait .
User 2: If I were the man making the decisions , you could get in line tomorrow . I strongly support ordinary people going into space . Unfortunately , I don't think it will be in the near future .

orig:
User 1: How do you think the transport system in our city could be improved ?
User 2: I think that the public transport system could be made simpler . I never know where the bus routes actually go . The routes seem to twist and turn rather than going roughly in a straight line .
User 1: I think we just need to build more roads . Then there would be more space for cars to drive and we ’ d have fewer traffic jams .
User 2: If we built more roads , people would just fill them with cars again . I think we should discourage people from using their cars .
User 1: How would you do that ?
User 2: I think we should do a few things at once . Improving public transport would encourage people to use that . If we also charge people to use their cars in the city centre , they won ’ t use their cars as much .
User 1: I don ’ t know . I think it ’ s unfair to make drivers pay more money . They already pay a lot of tax-petrol tax , for example .
User 2: I think that they should pay more tax . Look at the damage they cause to the environment and people ’ s health by discharging all those exhaust fumes .
User 1: The air would certainly be cleaner if there were fewer cars being used in the city . The problem is that people will see it as reducing their freedom . It well be unpopular .
User 2: That ’ s a good point . Car owners will probably be against it , but people who use public transport will be in favor of it .

orig:
User 1: I've heard so much about Japan . Is it a beautiful country ?
User 2: Not everyone thinks Japan is beautiful , but to me its beauty is breathtaking.You feel the same way about France , don't you ?
User 1: Yes , I do feel the same way about France . The swift rivers , the fertile valleys , the large cities-its scenery is beautiful . Will you describe the geography of Japan ?
User 2: Well , it's made up of four large islands and many smaller islands located off the coast of the Asian main lands . France isn't an island , is it ?
User 1: Oh , no , France isn't an island . It is located in the western part of the European continent . But France does have many fine harbors and port cities on its southern and western coasts . Does Japan have good harbors ?
User 2: Good harbors ! Yokohama is one of the most famous port cities in the world , and Japan is the largest shipbuilding nation in the world . Also , there are long mountain ranges in the southern is hands . France isn't very mountainous , is it ?
User 1: No , France isn't very mountainous . But it does contain the Pyrenees , a large mountain range with high peaks and deep canyons . What kind of Climate does Japan have ?
User 2: The Japanese climate is warm and moist in the south , mild in the central part and cold in the north . Except for Hokkaido , we don't get much snowfall at all . France has a mild climate , doesn't it ?
User 1: Yes , the climate of France rarely has severe winters . In southern France , one can live in comfort the whole year . Is Japan good for farming ?
User 2: Yes , Japan is good for farming . Rice is the main crop , but Japan is also an industrial center . Fishing is very important , too . Rice isn't grown in France , is it ?
User 1: No , rice isn't grown in France . But farming , fishing and industry are also very important in France . I'd like to go to Japan some day . Would you like to visit France ?
User 2: Yes . I'd like to visit France . I'd like to travel all over the world . As you describe it , France seems to be very much like Japan . I would like to see it for myself .

User 1: Oh , George , what a beautiful day it is today ! The sun is hot and there are just a few clouds scattered here and there ! What a perfect day to be at the beach ! The kids are going to have so much fun ! And we ’ ll be able to relax in the sun while they ’ re playing .
User 2: It does seem like the perfect day ! I ’ m glad we chose to get out of the city and enjoy the nice weather ! This looks like the perfect spot ! Ok kids , put on your sunscreen while your mom and I set up camp . Here , Mary , help me lay down these beach towels .
User 1: There we go . Can you help me with the umbrella ? Perfect .
User 2: Ok kids , here ’ sa beach ball and a Frisbee , a pail and a shovel . I want to see an impressive sandcastle by the time we leave . Don ’ t stray too far . Wait ! Leave your sandals here or put on your wet shoes .
User 1: And stay in the shallow area . I don ’ t want to see you go any farther than that sandbar ! It ’ s too deep out there and we didn ’ t bring your floatier .
User 2: You ’ re back already ? The water was too cold , huh ? I ’ ll tell you a secret . Do you see that small pool of water over there ? It ’ ll be warmer in there . Go see if you can find some seashells or catch some minnows .
User 1: What is that ? A jellyfish ? Jeremy , put that down right now ! It could sting you !
User 2: Ah ! Not on me ! Ow !

User 1: The air quality in this city is horrendous . The pollution levels are so high that we are not supposed to go outside with a face mask again !
User 2: Exhaust fumes from vehicles cause a great deal of damage to the environment .
User 1: On top of that , there are a few large chemical factories in the suburbs , which are contributing to the high pollution levels in the water and the air in this city .
User 2: As much as I love this city , I think I'm going to find a greener city to live in . Living in a polluted city like this just can't be good for my health .
User 1: I know what you mean . However , there are so few places left that have not been affected by global warming . If it's not the pollution , then it's the natural disasters , deforestation , or the greenhouse effect .
User 2: What is the greenhouse effect exactly ?
User 1: It's the gradual rise in the earth's temperature .
User 2: I see , so it's similar to global warming ?
User 1: They're related to one another , yes .
User 2: I heard that some people in England are pleased with the fact that the climate is becoming warmer because it's making their towns a more pleasant place to live .
User 1: People joke about the benefits of the increase in temperature , but it's not all good news . They've been experiencing a lot of deadly storms there as well .
User 2: People always seem to make jokes as a way to deal with unfortunate situations .
User 1: I think if everyone pitches in , the world will be a better place .

User 1: So , Emily , how was your day ?
User 2: I don't think you really want to hear about it .
User 1: It can't have been that bad . Go on and tell me about it .
User 2: To be honest , it was horrible ! My manager is such a pain in the neck !
User 1: Why ? What happened ?
User 2: Well , he made quite a few mistakes on the monthly report and when his supervisor found them , my manager blamed them on me !
User 1: That's not very fair . What did you do ?
User 2: There wasn't really anything that I could do . There's always been a lot of bad blood between my manager and myself . If I had said anything , he would have fired for me for sure .
User 1: Does he treat everyone in your department like this ?
User 2: He treats everyone pretty poorly , but the way he treats me really takes the cake !
User 1: Do you have any idea why he treats you worse than the others ?
User 2: I really have no idea . All I know is that the thought of him really curls my hair !
User 1: Is there anyone else you can talk to about it at you company ?
User 2: Not really . I'm hoping to live with it for a while until I get a promotion .
User 1: That's very sensible . It sounds like you have a good head on you shoulders .
User 2: I try to be sensible about it , but it's not very easy . Sometimes you just have to grin and bear it .
User 1: That's so true . When you have a taste for success , you can't let dishonest people like your manager get in the way .

User 1: Hey , look at the offer I got in my e-mail . It says that I can get rich quickly while working at home !
User 2: Do you also believe in Santa Claus and the Tooth Fairy ?
User 1: What do you mean ?
User 2: I mean that you're gullible . You shouldn't believe everything you read , especially on the Internet .
User 1: But it seems like a good idea . All I have to do is first send some money to the person who sent me the letter . After that he'll tell me how to earn much more money .
User 2: Sounds like a pyramid scheme . Have you heard of those before ?
User 1: Pyramid scheme ? What is that ?
User 2: It's a scam 7 that's based on a hierarchy , like a pyramid . The person at the top asks the people below him for money , and then tells them to go and ask other people for money while sending some of it back to him .
User 1: Sounds good to me . The guy at the top gets money and so do the people below him .
User 2: Not exactly . The scam keeps on going , with the people at the bottom paying more and more money until they reach the very bottom .
User 1: What happens then ?
User 2: Nothing . The people at the bottom give their money to the people above them , and they get nothing . They end up losing . That's why it's a scam .
User 1: I see . I guess I should be more careful about what I read , especially on the Internet where you have no idea who anybody is .

orig:
User 1: Look , here're two coins named Kai Yuan Tong Bao — the sort of coin made in memory of the founding of a new dynasty . These two coins were made in different periods of the Tang Dynasty .
User 2: How can you tell the difference ? From what I see , they look almost the same .
User 1: The one made in the early Tang period is bigger and has more characters on it , while the one with smaller and elegant characters was made in late Tang period . Look carefully , and tell me if you see the difference now .
User 2: Yes , they are different ! But it's too professional . What I need is just being able to tell the real from the fake . Do you know any method we can use to tell a fake ancient coin ?
User 1: Various methods were used in history to produce fake coins . We usually send the coin to an authorized unit to have it tested by experts with special machines . We can judge it with naked eyes .
User 2: I see . By the way , China was more than once ruled by foreign tribes in history . Did they issue their own coins in China ?
User 1: Certainly , they did . Liao Coins and Song Coins , for example , coexisted in circulation during the Southern Song and Yuan period some 800 -1000 years ago . The Liao Coins look plain and bold in style , just like the characteristics of the Mongolian tribe . Let me look for one and show you .
User 2: If you happen to find one , please bargain with the owner for it . I'd like to have one . It's interesting to see the integration of the Han and Mongolian cultures on this small piece of metal .

User 1: What do you think is harder , reading or writing ?
User 2: Well , they ’ re completely different . Reading is passive , and writing is active .
User 1: I don ’ t think I understand what you mean . Could you explain a little more ?
User 2: In reading you need to recognize language by seeing the words on the page and knowing what they are . In writing you have to produce language , you have to create your own words on a blank page .
User 1: Oh , now I see what you mean . When you ’ re reading , you are just looking , but when you are writing , you are actually doing something !
User 2: A reading knowledge of a language is larger and different from a writing knowledge . Don ’ t you think so ?
User 1: I think I see what you mean . I can read Shakespeare but I definitely can ’ t write it .
User 2: Exactly .
User 1: So I have another question for you . What do you think is harder , speaking or understanding ?
User 2: They ’ re both harder than reading or writing .
User 1: In what way ?
User 2: Because they are direct communication with another person , and there ’ s a time limit . This time limit is the most serious problem for foreigners , even for those who know lots of English .
User 1: You are making me feel really discouraged .
User 2: I ’ m not trying to discourage you . I ’ m trying to help you . You have to live with these difficulties . Isn ’ t it better to know about them ? The more you know about what you have to face , the better you ’ ll do . I promise !

User 2: You can buy things at post office that were never sold there before . You can buy sweets and chocolates , newspapers , birthday and Christmas cards ...
User 1: Post offices are still the place to go to collect welfare benefits , like unemployment benefit and child support benefit . The queue are very long on the days when people collect those payment .
User 2: My son likes going to the main post office . They have a philately counter where he can buy stamps for his collection .
User 1: Do you think that the service at post offices has improved ?
User 2: I think it ’ s better for some things , like sending and receiving money , but if you need to post something it sometimes takes longer than it used to .
User 1: I like being able to buy newspapers and magazines at the post office . It means that I don ’ t need to go to two places

User 1: Those are the headlines for today , and now for the international weather report with Mike Sanderson .
User 2: Thank you , Bob ! This past week has been the beginning of Armageddon for many , a series of unprecedented meteorological events occurred around the world . In Switzerland , a major avalanche was reported in the Alps . Fortunately , no one was injured . Due to to the extreme cold this winter , a blizzard has struck the US Midwest , causing classes in schools and universities to be temporarily canceled . Moving to to Latin American , Ecuador has suffered a six month drought that has not only affected farming , but has also forced the closure of the hydroelectric power plant that provides electricity for the entire country . In Chile , a major earthquake that registered seven point five on the Richter scale struck the southern region . Losses are reported to be in the billions . Authorities have not yet released an official statement .
User 1: Not a great week for the world ! Any good news ?
User 2: I ’ m afraid not , Bob . One of the major volcanoes in Mexico has erupted , causing major floods and landslides in the region . Meanwhile , Mexico ’ s coast has been hit by hurricane Liliana and officials say that all the seismic activity leads them to believe that a tsunami may hit Central America , affecting Honduras , Guatemala and Panama . That ’ s all the news we have for today , but stay tuned for updates on the six o ’ clock news . Back to you Bob .

orig:
User 1: I ’ Ve had it ! I ’ m done working for a company that is taking me nowhere !
User 2: So what are you gonna do ? Just quit ?
User 1: That ’ s exactly what I am going to do ! I ’ Ve decided to create my own company ! I ’ m going to write up a business plan , get some investors and start working for myself !
User 2: Have you ever written up a business plan before ?
User 1: Well , no.it can ’ t be that hard ! I mean , all you have to do is explain your business , how you are going to do things and that ’ s it , right ?
User 2: You couldn ’ t be more wrong ! A well written business plan will include an executive summary which highlights the idea of the business in two pages or less . Then you need to describe your company with information such as what type of legal structure it has , history , etc .
User 1: Well , that seems easy enough .
User 2: Wait , there ’ s more ! Then you need to introduce and describe your goods or services . What they are and how they are different from competitors ’ ? Then comes the hard part , a market analysis . You need to investigate and analyze hundreds of variables ! You need to take into consideration socioeconomic factors from GDP per capita to how many children on average the population has ! All this information is useful so that you can move on to your strategy and implementation stage , where you will describe in detail how you will actually execute your idea .
User 1: Geez . Is that all ?
User 2: Almost , the most important piece of information for your investors will be the financial analysis . Here you will calculate and estimate sales , cash flow and profits . After all , people will want to know when they will begin to see a return on their investment !
User 1: Umm . I think I ’ ll just stick to my old job and save myself all the hassle of trying to start up a business !
User 2:

orig:
User 1: Bob ! Your eyes look bloodshot . Did you not sleep well ?
User 2: I had a drop too much last night . I attended a banquet given by a Chinese colleague of mine . And it was startling for me to find that people are forced to drink against their will on a Chinese table .
User 1: you have it right . Alcohol is a medium for communicating emotion in China . Drinking with business partners or would-be friends is a way of solidifying friendship , especially in Northern China .
User 2: I just felt embarrassed if I refused to drink when people toasted to me . But if I keep gulping down one cup after another , I'm afraid I would feel unfit or sick .
User 1: you lose face by refusing to drink , and the host might think you refuse to give him face . The right thing to do seems to be drinking yourself into incoherence until you throw up . This will endear you
User 2: a few guys even threw a drunken fit last night , crying hoarsely and bawling whole heaps of nonsense that I never understood .
User 1: then he must be opening his heart to the friends . In a word , as long as you demonstrate a readiness to drink more in spite of already suffering extreme discomfort , no one will jeer at you .
User 2: I got you . Next time . I'll preface a toast with a statement like ' I can't drink any more ' and then drink anyway .
User 1:

User 2: I had a drop too much last night. I attended a banquet given by a Chinese colleague of mine. And it was startling for me to find that people are forced to drink against their will on a Chinese table.
User 1: You have it right. Alcohol is a medium for communicating emotion in China. Drinking with business partners or would-be friends is a way of solidifying friendship, especially in Northern China.
User 2: I just felt embarrassed if I refused to drink when people toasted to me. But if I keep gulping down one cup after another, I'm afraid I would feel unfit or sick.
User 1: You lose face by refusing to drink, and the host might think you refuse to give him face. The right thing to do seems to be drinking yourself into incoherence until you throw up. This will endear you.
User 2: A few guys even threw a drunken fit last night, crying hoarsely and bawling whole heaps of nonsense that I never understood.
User 1: Then he must be opening his heart to the friends. In a word, as long as you demonstrate a readiness to drink more in spite of already suffering extreme discomfort, no one will jeer at you.
User 2: I got you. Next time. I'll preface a toast with a statement like 'I can't drink any more' and then drink anyway.

User 2: What is a tornado warning ?

User 2: But if you hear them coming , isn't it already too late ?
User 1: Maybe . It depends on the tornado.Some can move across the ground at 200 miles an hour.That is very fast . Others aren't so fast .

User 2: That's terrible . Do many people die in tornadoes ?
User 1: Not so many really . But a lot of houses are destroyed sometimes .

User 1: So it looks like we start selling in the U . S . next year .
User 2: Did Mr . Lin put you in charge of marketing ?
User 1: He's still not sure whether he wants to put me in charge , or whether he wants to hire an American.But even if he hires an American , I'll probably be transferred to our American office .
User 2: Where will it be ?
User 1: We aren't sure yet . Maybe L . A . I think L . A . would be the best idea .
User 2: Is it because of trade negotiations that we can start selling in the U . S . ?
User 1: Yes , the recent agreements between the two governments have changed everything.Now we have the right to sell in America at a much lower tariff.It ' s going to be good . We can compete more directly with them .
User 2: Great .
User 1: Our computers have a high level of quality now.We can demonstrate it . And our prices will be good.So I think it will really be worthwhile .
User 2: You seem excited about it .
User 1: Well , you know I studied marketing in America.So maybe the thought of going back there to promote our brand is kind of exciting to me . I'd love to be part of the team .
User 2: Do you honestly think we can compete though ? All the computer giants are there .
User 1: Yes , I do . I think we can compete . I think we can make a name for ourselves.It will be hard at first . But if we develop a good advertising campaign , I think we can break into the market .
User 2: The company will have to choose a good advertising firm.And then there's the problem of quality.How do we convince American buyers that our quality is good ?
User 1: It takes some time.Because even if the quality is high , people won't accept a high tech product unless they recognize the name.Name recognition is crucial .
User 2: Well , I hope it all works out , John . I think if you're part of the team , things will go well.But you know we'd all miss you here . So I won't say I'm happy to think that you're leaving .
User 1: That's very nice of you to say.But if we set up an office there in the States , maybe you could try to become part of it .
User 2: Me ? No way . I'm dedicated to the company , but I'm not going to leave Taiwan . I'm happy here .

content:
User 1: So it looks like we start selling in the U.S. next year.
User 2: Did Mr. Lin put you in charge of marketing?
User 1: He's still not sure whether he wants to put me in charge, or whether he wants to hire an American. But even if he hires an American, I'll probably be transferred to our American office.
User 2: Where will it be?
User 1: We aren't sure yet. Maybe L.A. I think L.A. would be the best idea.
User 2: Is it because of trade negotiations that we can start selling in the U.S.?
User 1: Yes, the recent agreements between the two governments have changed everything. Now we have the right to sell in America at a much lower tariff. It's going to be good. We can compete more directly with them.
User 2: Great.
User 1: Our computers have a high level of quality now. We can demonstrate it. And our prices will be good. So I think it will really be worthwhile.
User 2: You seem excited about it.
User 1: Well, you know I studied marketing in America. So maybe the thought of going back there to promote our brand is kind of exciting to me. I'd love to be part of the team.
User 2: Do you honestly think we can compete though? All the computer giants are there.
User 1: Yes, I do. I think we can compete. I think we can make a name for ourselves. It will be hard at first. But if we develop a good advertising campaign, I think we can break into the market.
User 2: The company will have to choose a good advertising firm. And then there's the problem of quality. How do we convince American buyers that our quality is good?

User 1: It seems that English already is the main global language . Does the article suggest that there should be an artificial language like Esperanto as the world language .
User 2: Actually , it suggest English . The main argument is that English is already being studied as a second language in most countries-china , India , mexico , Nigeria , Pakistan , and japan . So beginning again with a language like Esperanto would be wasteful . The second argument is that English is used in modern technology far more that any other language . Most emails are sent in English and the vast majority of website use English .
User 1: Does the article say anything about other language ? How will they survive in an English-speaking world ?
User 2: The article points out that many languages have been lost and will be lost , but others will continue to be used for generation , even if English continues to be the dominant language .
User 1: Right . All the people who speak Chinese . Hindi , French and Spanish aren ’ t suddenly going to stop using those languages .
User 2: Exactly . The article suggests that those languages will be used , but that they will only rarely be used in international communication between non-native speakers .
User 1: In that case , I shall continue to learning a few basic phrases in other languages .

User 1: So Chris , I've heard that you're from a big family . How many people ?
User 2: Nine total . Seven children and my parents .
User 1: Seven children ? That's a lot . Why did your parents have so many ?
User 2: Well , my mother came from a big family , and wanted to have one of her own . My father was an only child , and didn't really care about having a large family , but my mother talked him into it .
User 1: Jeez , seven children . That must have a lot of problems . We have four children in my family and my grandparents can never get our names right .
User 2: It can be hard , and there are certain sacrifices you have to make .
User 1: Like what ? I assume that there's no privacy .
User 2: That's one . Another is the lack of personal property . Everything you have , from toys to clothes , is used by your brothers and sisters . Especially clothes . Three quarters of my wardrobe are hand-me-downs .
User 1: And the age gap is also annoying . There's a ten-year difference between my younger brother and me . We have nothing in common .
User 2: Same problem here . There's an 18 - year gap between the oldest and youngest child in my family . The last child was born just as the oldest was going to college .
User 1: Well , at least going to college won't be too bad . Since both of your parents are college professors , they must give you reduced tuition at the college .
User 2: They do , but it doesn't help too much . Having seven children means that the money situation in my home is always pretty tight .

User 2: My husband and I got married in a registry office with just two friends there as witnesses . But then we had three parties to celebrate .

User 1: Were your parents upset that they weren't there to see you get married ?

User 1: That makes sense . Did you go on a honeymoon ?
User 2: We waited until our one-year anniversary to go on our honeymoon to Africa .
User 1: You really didn't have a very traditional wedding , did you ?
User 2: Not at all , but we don ’ t have a very traditional marriage either , so it suited us perfectly !

orig:
User 1: Do you believe in horoscope fortune-telling ?
User 2: I used to be an atheist . But in recent months , I couldn't but form a more favorable opinion of horoscope .
User 1: That sounds interesting . Have you been involved in any mystery ?
User 2: Not exactly , except that I find horoscope predictions increasingly accurate . I came upon a website which sends me an up-dated message by e-mail each day forecasting my experience in detail . It is amazing to find these forecasts largely in line with my daily life .
User 1: What did it say about you then ?
User 2: For example , the message for the day before yesterday notified me that I , as a Leo guy , was to have some " unusual experience in food and drink . And as it turned out , the reality matched this prediction well . Lasi night , I was treated to a dinner party by Mr . Lee .
User 1: But it must have been only a coincidence . That's the only way superstition wins over science .
User 2: Oh , no . You can never tell whether such-and-such is science or sheer fraud.If horoscope is really something deceptive , how come quite a size of proportion of young people think highly of it .
User 1: For fun . It serves as a shared topic to them.While they claim to consult the predictions constantly and marvel at their " accuracy ' . they do not necessarily take them seriously . When it that these predictions are matched by their real-life experiences , they delight in spreading the thrill with friends . But if there isn't any correlation between reality and predictions , they just grin , forget about them , and go on living as usual .
User 2:
content:
User 1: Do you believe in horoscope fortune-telling?
User 2: I used to be an atheist. But in recent months, I couldn't but form a more favorable opinion of horoscope.
User 1: That sounds interesting. Have you been involved in any mystery?
User 2: Not exactly, except that I find horoscope predictions increasingly accurate. I came upon a website which sends me an updated message by e-mail each day forecasting my experience in detail. It is amazing to find these forecasts largely in line with my daily life.
User 1: What did it say about you then?
User 2: For example, the message for the day before yesterday notified me that I, as a Leo guy, was to have some "unusual experience in food and drink". And as it turned out, the reality matched this prediction well. Last night, I was treated to a dinner party by Mr. Lee.
User 1: But it must have been only a coincidence. That's the only way superstition wins over science.
User 2: Oh, no. You can never tell whether such-and-such is science or sheer fraud. If horoscope is really something deceptive, how come quite a size of proportion of young people think highly of it.
User 1: For fun. It serves as a shared topic to them. While they claim to consult the predictions constantly and marvel at their "accuracy", they do not necessarily take them seriously. When it that these predictions are matched by their real-life experiences, they delight in spreading the thrill with friends. But if there isn't any correlation between reality and predictions, they just grin, forget about them, and go on living as usual.

content:
User 1: I am kind of nervous.
User 2: Nervous? Why?
User 1: I don't know. I never went to a church before. I was not raised as a Christian, so I don't know what to do.
User 2: Don't worry. You don't have to do anything. All you have to do is listen. You will enjoy it.
User 1: Maybe. I know I agreed to go with you, but now I don't feel right about it.
User 2: Listen, Ryan. Catholics welcome people who aren't Catholics to visit the church. You don't have to pretend to be Catholic. It's okay if you just come to listen.
User 1: Really?
User 2: Yes. We are kind and welcoming people. It is not a secret society or something like that.
User 1: Alright. But will we sing?
User 2: Yes, but you don't even have to sing. If you want to sing along, you can.
User 1: I don't know the words.
User 2: There is a songbook. All the words are in the songbook. Many people have to read the words.
User 1: And will I go up to the front to have the bread and wine?
User 2: No. That is something only true Catholics do. So if you come to the church as a visitor, you only listen to the service. But you shouldn't go up to the altar for the bread and wine. Only after someone joins the church, then they go up for the Eucharist.
User 1: Eu-char-ist? What is that?
User 2: That is the special word for the ritual of the bread and wine. The Catholics call it the Eucharist.
User 1: It doesn't sound like an English word.
User 2: It's not. It's an ancient Greek word. It means gratitude.
User 1: Alright. Well, I feel more comfortable now. Now I understand I am welcome as a visitor.
User 2: Of course you are. I wouldn't ask you otherwise.

User 2: You're so old-fashioned . That's what people used to think about people from another country !
User 1: Point taken . Hopefully one day , we'll live in an interplanetary society .

orig:
User 1: Hey Susan , what are you coming as this year ?
User 2: Coming as ?
User 1: Yeah ... for Halloween ! We have a big office party tomorrow evening . There's a prize for best costume !
User 2: Um ... I have to confess , I haven't given it much thought . I'm from China and Halloween really isn't celebrated there .
User 1: Really ! You don't have some kind of Chinese ghost festival ?
User 2: Oh ... Sure . We have an entire month ! In traditional Chinese culture , Ghost Month is a period when the door between this world and beyond opens up and ghosts come back to earth for a visit .
User 1: Cool ! A whole month ! What do you do during that month ?
User 2: Well , people sometimes set off firecrackers , some people burn paper money as an offering and many people go to a temple to burn incense.Mainly though , you need to feed the ghosts because they're hungry .
User 1: Feed them ?
User 2: Yeah ... we set up tables with food , fruit and drinks and offer that to the hungry ghosts .
User 1: And then later everyone eats the food ?
User 2: Yes ! How did you guess that ?
User 1: It makes sense , right ? Who else is going to eat it ?
User 2: Good Point !
User 1: But no dressing up like ghosts , right ?
User 2: No ! So ... is Halloween essentially the same thing as ghost month ?

orig:
User 1: Good afternoon , sir . You are really a regular customer here . May I ask you why you come here so often ?
User 2: I'm a newspaper columnist . I write comments for a living . I enjoy working in a coffeehouse .
User 1: I see . But isn't it a bit too noisy ?
User 2: I don't mind . By contrast , I quite like the circumstances , as I can see a variety of people here , who can always give me tremendous inspiration . And the most important thing is coffee as it is my life .
User 1: I can see that . Then what is your favorite coffee ?
User 2: Irish coffee is my favorite . But I can drink any other . I'm not particular on it .
User 1: All right . Would you make coffee yourself when you are at home ?
User 2: Not very often . Making coffee is a bit troublesome . Most of the time , I just buy takeout at Starbucks . And also , I quite like instant coffee .
User 1: I think instant coffee is becoming more and more popular . Though its taste is not perfect , it's really cheap and convenient .
User 2: Exactly . Nescafe is the world's favorite coffee . People love it all over the world ?
User 1: Which country makes the best coffee in the world ?
User 2: Many people think Brazil makes the best coffee . Brazil exports a lot of coffee . But I love Irish coffee . So it's hard to say . Just depends on your taste .
User 1: I agree . I heard in the western countries , almost everyone likes coffee . Is that true ?
User 2: Yes . No doubt about that . For us , coffee is more a living style rather than a simple drink . I heard Chinese people don't drink that much coffee .
User 1: No , we don't , especially the old people . But more and more young people fall for coffee .
User 2: I suppose so . That's probably why there are so many wonderful coffeehouses in China now .

User 1: I'm reading an interesting report on Mars .
User 2: Oh , what does it say ? Does it say water could still exist under the surface of Mars ?
User 1: Absolutely ! It says there is water on Mars buried beneath the surface . It's just a matter of how deep it is .
User 2: Then could the soil on Mars somehow be fertile enough to Groh simple plants ?
User 1: The soil would need quite a bit of fertilizer to grow anything . And it would need to be protected from the UV radiation .
User 2: Actually , we are doing a project in school that involves landing a ship and staying on Mars for an extended period of time . Does NASA have any type of portable habitats that could be used to stay on the planet ?
User 1: I'm not sure NASA has built any portable habitats for extended stays on Mars , but they have looked at various designs .
User 2: One of the most exciting things about Mars is that there could have bean life on it . What are your personal opinions on the life on Mars theory ?
User 1: Well , I'm not really an expert in this area , but my understanding is that anything is possible . It's just that it is so hard to determine what went on 4.5 billion years ago .
User 2: But maybe there is a chance of gradually improving the surface and atmosphere of Mars so it may be inhabitable by humans .
User 1: I'm skeptical . Mars is made of rocks containing silicon , iron , and various minerals . It also has an atmosphere of carbon dioxide . It is so different from what we have on earth , you know .
User 2: I'd still like to hope that some day we could set up a human colony there .
User 1: But there are still other big problems we need to solve such as prolonged weightlessness , food storage , and a series of physiological effects .

User 1: What are we going to do ? I can't get the car out of this ditch . I'm stuck !
User 2: I'm worried , Tom . I haven't seen any other cars for almost an hour .
User 1: I know . This is terrible . What can we do ? This snow doesn't stop falling !
User 2: I told you we should have stayed in town today.The weather report said 100 percent chance of snow.Why did you want to come up here ?
User 1: I wanted to show you the cabin . We only had another half-hour to go .
User 2: Well , now we're stuck . What can we do ?
User 1: I don't know .
User 2: I've heard that when this happens , it's important to save energy .
User 1: What do you mean ?
User 2: We're stranded here , Tom . We may be here a long time.We need to conserve the gas in the car . The car's energy is what will keep us warm .
User 1: I have plenty of gas .
User 2: Yes , but the gas and the battery both have to stay working.We can't just let the car run and run.If we do , it will die soon . Then we'll freeze .
User 1: So what can we do ?
User 2: Turn the lights off.Then , run the car and the heater only about fifteen minutes every hour.That will conserve the heat as long as possible .
User 1: Alright . That's a good idea .
User 2: I wish we hadn't come up here . Now we'll probably be here for days .
User 1: Days ?
User 2: Yes , it happens.That is what happens in big snowstorms . People get stranded for days .
User 1: Oh , my God ! It's good we have food .
User 2: Probably we'll survive.But turn the car off for about forty-five minutes . Then we'll turn it on again .
User 1: Okay , I'll follow your advice .

It is not enough to simply memorize our laws , it is necessary that we comprehend why and how they were formed . This brings me to our topic for today . Does anyone know what we celebrate on May first ?
User 2: Cinct de mayo ?
User 1: No , that ’ s May fifth in Spanish , James , no wonder you are failing my Spanish class . No , May first is International Workers ’ Day .
User 2: Do we get a day off from school then ?
User 1: No ! It is not considered to be a national holiday here in the US , but in other countries it is .
User 2: Www , man !
User 1: In the nineteenth century , working conditions were appalling , with workers being forced to work ten , twelve , and fourteen hours a day . Support for the eight-hour work day movement was growing rapidly , despite the indifference and hostility of many union leaders , and by April 1886 , 250,000 workers were involved in the May Day movement . Previous legislative attempts to improve working conditions had failed , so labor organizers took drastic measures . They passed a resolution stating that eight hours would constitute a legal day ’ s work . And , on May First 1886 , the resolution took effect .
User 2: Cool ! Is that why we only work eight hours now ?
User 1: Yes ! But the happy ending came at a high price.On May third , 1886 , police fired into a crowd of strikers at the McCormick Reaper Works Factory , killing four and wounding many . A mass meeting was called for the next day to protest the brutality .
User 2: And then what happened ?
User 1: Well , as we say , the rest is history ...

User 1: When you use the internet , be careful not to give out your email address very often . If you do , you might get a lot of spam-unwanted email from companies trying to sell you things .
User 2: That ’ s good advice . I should also be careful about giving out confidential information about myself , such as my password and credit car number .
User 1: That ’ s right . Another thing to remember when you are surfing is that you can add a web page to your list of favourites . Your computer will remember the page and you can return there quickly next time you want to visit .
User 2: How do I do that ?
User 1: Take this web page for example . Press the keys “ control ” and “ d ” together . Click on “ favourites ” at the top of the screen . There you are . It has been added to you favourites list . If you click it , you will automatically go to that web page again .
User 2: That ’ s useful to know . Thanks . I ’ ll just log off and shout down my computer and we can go for a coffee .

content:
User 1: What's all the security check about, Jimmy? Does it mean the bar may be a dangerous place?
User 2: No, of course not. Just in case. Nothing to worry about. Don't you also do this in China?
User 1: I don't know. Maybe the same. Actually, this is my first time being in a bar.
User 2: Oh, then it's my honor to be here with you. I can see now why you've been so curious about the bar. You like this place?
User 1: Sure. I love this place, especially the decoration. So tasteful!
User 2: Yeah. Other than that, the real feature is the excellent drinks. Can I have your ticket?
User 1: Here it is. But, what for? We're already in.
User 2: Well, with the ticket, you can get a free drink. What would you like? Orange juice?
User 1: Yes, orange juice will be fine for me. But how can you get the drink? It's so crowded there around the counter. You can barely move.
User 2: I'll show you how. The bar tenders know whose turn it is. And also, I can snap my fingers to catch his attention.
User 1: Cool. Thanks. (Jimmy brings May a glass of orange juice.)
User 2: Oh, fresh juice, I love it. Well, I heard American people love hanging out in bars. Is that true?
User 1: Not everyone. But a lot of people do, especially the young. It's a fine place to spend an evening with friends or to make some new friends.
User 2: Interesting. Hey, look over there. The dance floor is already packed with people. Oh, the girl in red dances great.
User 1: Yeah, a dancing queen. Wanna go and join them?
User 2: Maybe later. I wanna take some photos first.
User 1: OK. Let me help you to hold the drink.
User 2: Thank you.
User 1:

orig:
User 1: Matthew , do you know much about body language in countries around the world ?
User 2: Sure , I've picked up a few things from travelling around for work . Why ?
User 1: Well , I had a meeting today with a woman from Japan and she wouldn't stop bowing ! I didn't know what to do !
User 2: Did you bow back ?
User 1: No , I tried to shake her hand , but her hand was so limp I was a bit offended .
User 2: Well , Japanese businessmen and women typically bow to greet each other in Japan . She might have been offended by your strong handshake .
User 1: But she was in America ! Shouldn't she have known that strong handshakes in America signify confidence and respect ?
User 2: Things are different in Japan . You know , in some countries , making eye contact with others is considered rude .
User 1: Is that why she wouldn ’ t look at me in the meeting ?
User 2: I think it's highly possible , yes .
User 1: The meeting really didn ’ t go down well at all . I think I need to read up about intercultural communication before I have another meeting with someone from another country .
User 2: That's a good idea . When you don ’ t know much about other cultures , the simplest thing can offend someone .
User 1: That's so true . It's great that we see eye to eye on this .
User 2:

orig:
User 1: welcome back ! How was your vacation ?
User 2: it was fantastic , but I'm glad to be back ! Being a tourist is really tiring !
User 1: where did you end up going ?
User 2: because it's off-season , we got a really good package deal to Paris , so we went there .
User 1: I've always wanted to go to Paris . The Eiffel Tower is one of the most famous tourist attractions in the world ! Did you go to the top ?
User 2: that was the first thing we did . I have a few pictures . Do you want to see them ?
User 1: sure . What's this one a picture of ?
User 2: oh , that's a picture of me on our fourth day of travelling . I'm standing next to a famous foundation in the centre of the city .
User 1: you don't look very happy in that picture .
User 2: no , by that time , I was sick of sightseeing . I had had enough of art galleries , cathedrals , fountains , statues , and palaces !
User 1: so what did you do ?
User 2: we spent that afternoon walking around a flea market . We had a few coffees , watched a movie , and went for a swim in the pool at the hotel .
User 1: my travel agent always reminds me to plan a day of relaxing for every 3 days of sightseeing . Did you go to the Louvre ?
User 2: of course ! You can't go to Paris without going to their famous art gallery ! I was surprised by how small the Mona Lisa was though .
User 1: that's what everyone says ! I can't wait to see it for myself some day .

User 1: How is everything going with your girlfriend ?
User 2: Didn ’ t I tell you ? It ’ s over !
User 1: Oh , I am sorry to hear that . I did ’ t know that you had split up . What happened ?
User 2: It was a few things . The first thing that happened was that we were supposed to go out for a romantic dinner for our one year anniversary , but she stood me up !
User 1: Really ! Did she tell you why she didn ’ t show up ?
User 2: No , but I ended up finding out later that night when I saw her with another man at a club near my home !
User 1: What was she thinking ? Did you confront her about it when you saw her ?
User 2: I wanted to , but I knew that if I spoke to her , I'd just blow up at her , so I decided to just go home . I called her later that night , but she didn't answer the phone .
User 1: I can ’ t believe she would do that to you . It ’ s so dishonest---and rude !
User 2: I know . I still haven ’ t heard from her . The good thing is that I ’ m so angry with her that I don ’ t feel sad about not having her around .
User 1: I bet you she regrets what she ’ s done . You were such a good catch ! She really lost out , didn ’ t she ?
User 2: I guess so . It would be nice to know why she did this though .
User 1: I know . It ’ s always nice to have some closure , but I don ’ t think you ’ ll have a problem finding another girlfriend .

orig:
User 1: What kinds of Tv programs do you enjoy watching ?
User 2: I like current affairs programs and documentaries , especially wildlife ones . How about you ?
User 1: I like those kinds of programs too . They ’ re very informative . I think that many people underrate the education value of Tv .
User 2: I agree . People often criticize Tv for showing too much sex and violence .
User 1: Yeah . And that ’ s so funny because most people prefer watching sex and violence to watching something more educational !
User 2: Right . You can ’ t blame the tv stations for showing popular kinds of programs . They need to make money from advertisements shown during and between programs .
User 1: In my country , there ’ s a time limit on the advertisements that can be shown . I think it ’ s about six minutes per hour .
User 2: That ’ s great idea . But don ’ t the Tv station lose a lot of money because of that ?
User 1: No . they don ’ t . they simply charge higher prices at peak times . Is there no limit on the amount of advertisements that can be shown on Tv in your country ?
User 2: Not as far as I know . We have so many advertisements . the interruptions are unbearable sometimes ! That ’ s one reason that many people prefer satellite or cable Tv , where you pay a fixed amount each month .
User 1: Some people have satellite and cable Tv in my country , but people don ’ t seem to keen to pay for their Tv programs . Besides , the terrestrial channels offer a good range of programs .
User 2: Well , there ’ s a wildlife documentary on Tv in a few minutes . Shall we ?

orig:
User 1: Doris , I'm glad you're home . I'm terrified . I don't know what to do !
User 2: What is it ? What happened ?
User 1: I think someone is stalking me .
User 2: No , it can't be . Really ? Who ?
User 1: I don't know . I saw him the first time Tuesday . He was at the cafe . I noticed he was looking at me a lot . Not just the usual looking , but staring.He just kept staring at me . He didn't stop .
User 2: What did you do ?
User 1: I didn't do anything . Finally , he left.But then I saw him again today . Outside the shoe store . Near the cafe . I went into a CD store and pretended I was looking at CD's . But then he came in too .
User 2: Did he leave when you left ?
User 1: Yes . Then I noticed he was on the sidewalk behind me . He was following me .
User 2: What did you do ?
User 1: He followed me all the way home !
User 2: That's about five blocks . And around corners too.So he was definitely following you .
User 1: Yes , he was . I'm not imagining it.Finally , just when I got home , I turned around and looked at him.He was just standing there . He didn't smile . He just stood there . It was so obvious.What should I do ? I'm so scared . Can I call the police ?
User 2: Actually , I don't think you can call the police . Not yet at least.He hasn't done anything . And probably the police will just ignore it.But if anything happens again , then maybe you should call .
User 1: Why can't I call the police now ? He was definitely following me !
User 2: Of course you can call the police if you want . That's not what I mean . I'm just saying that they probably won't do anything .
User 1: I suppose . What can they do ? I don't even know who he is .
User 2: Listen , Carol . Don't let this bother you too much.Probably it's nothing . Just keep your eyes open when you go out.If you see him a third time , and if he follows you again , then I think we should go to the police.But for now , just try not to worry .
User 1: Alright . And I won't go to that cafe for awhile .
User 2:

User 2: That's the way to go . Now , you are flying , my boy .

User 2: Yeah , everyday . And there ’ s only one choice.All the other buses are going the other direction .
User 1: Hmm . I have the same problem . When I leave work , it ’ s always rush hour.So the buses are always crowded .
User 2: Oh , yeah , it ’ s terrible . I will tell you the funniest thing I have seen in China . It ’ s when so many people try to get onto one city bus , and the last guy is squeezed in so tight that the door is tightly pressed against his butt .
User 1: That sounds terrible the way you describe it . But you know , not long ago I really suffered on the bus .
User 2: What happened ? Were you having a hard time getting on a bus ?
User 1: You just can ’ t imagine ! I waited for the first bus but it was too full , so I waited for the second , and it was still very crowded . Then I decided not to wait for the next one , and got on the second bus . It was so full that I had to stand on one foot ! No kidding !
User 2: Hmm . Good exercise , uh ?
User 1: Yeah , absolutely !
User 2: And it ’ s so much fun . One day , the bodies were so tightly packed that some girl ’ s behind was pressed against my front . I was afraid to put my hands down for fear of accidentally groping her .
User 1: You were so happy , weren ’ t you ?
User 2: What do you think ? I ’ m a good boy .

orig:
User 1: Hi , Ann . I was wondering if you are free tomorrow night ?
User 2: Well , George . I guess I am . Why do you ask ?
User 1: I've just gotten a pair of pre-sale Star Wars movie tickets from a friend and was thinking of inviting you along for the opening premiere . Are you interested ?
User 2: Yeah , definitely ! Thanks for inviting me .
User 1: My pleasure .
User 2: I really wanted to watch the Star Wars on the opening day , but the pre-sale tickets were sold out . How did you manage to get hold of them ?
User 1: A friend of mine works at the corporate headquarters of Pepsi , which is a major sponsor of the movie . He was able to get the tickets for free , and then he sold two more for me for 50 dollars a piece .
User 2: You paid 50 dollars for each ticket ? That's a huge premium over the regular price .
User 1: Not really . Considering the fact that other people were willing to pay as much as 200 dollars each on the black market . Besides , I knew you were really looking forward to watching Star Wars on the opening day .
User 2: Wow ! I am really honored you went through all this trouble just for my sake . I really appreciate that . So , what time are we going ?
User 1: Well , let's see . The movie stars at 10 . We should be there at least 1 hour earlier , because there is a big line . I could pick you up at your house at 8 , if that's ok with you .
User 2: 8 pm , that's fine with me .
User 1: Okay .
User 2: So I'll see you tomorrow then at 8 .
User 1: Yeah , that's great . I'll see you tomorrow night .
User 2: Ok , George . Bye !
User 1: Bye , Ann !

User 2: Yes . I am a bit confused . My sociology class is supposed to read a chapter in a book called Sociology and the Modern Age . According to the syllabus , the book is in the library , but I haven't been able to find it .
User 1: Do you have your syllabus with you ? May I see it ?
User 2: Yes , uh ... I put it in the front of my sociology notebook . Oh , here it is .
User 1: Let me see . Oh yes . Your professor has placed this book on reserve . That means you cannot find it on the shelves in its usual place . You need to go to a special room called the reserve room . It's down the hall and to the right .
User 2: I'm sorry - I still don't understand .
User 1: You see , your professor wants every one in the class to read the chapter . If one student removes the book from the library , it is likely that none of the other students will have the opportunity to read it . So , your professor has insured that all students have the opportunity to read it by placing it on reserve .
User 2: So , will I be able to find this book ?
User 1: Yes , when a book is on reserve , a student can go to the reserve room and ask the reserve librarian for the book . The student can have the book for a few hours , and he or she MUST read it in the library during that time . That way , the book stays in the library , and all students have a chance to read it .
User 2: Okay . Thank you . I understand now .
User 1: Will there be anything else ?
User 2: No ! I am on my way to the reserve room . Thanks again !

User 2: As you know , my city is on the coast.the water is also not clean.but people still go swimming all year around . i prefer to sand bath on the beach when the weather is hot in sunny .

content:
User 1: What's the weather like in your city?
User 2: In the summer it gets very hot. The temperature is often between 37 and 40 centigrade. When it is hot we often get rains. The winters are drier.
User 1: The summer temperature usually often reaches about 20 or 25 in my city. The rain falls mostly in the winter. And we often get snow.
User 2: What are the temperatures in winter? In my city it is about 15 or 20 degrees.

User 2: My grandmother said there was snow once when she was a child. But my parents and I only see it outside of our city.
User 1: The river in my city sometime freeze over. People go ice-skating on it. On summer people go boating on the river. But few people go swimming because it is not very clean.
User 2: As you know, my city is on the coast. The water is also not clean. But people still go swimming all year around. I prefer to sand bath on the beach when the weather is hot in sunny.

content:
User 1: I can't believe my English teacher is making me read Pride and Prejudice!
User 2: Why not! It's a classic; in fact, it's one of my favorite novels.
User 1: But it's so old.
User 2: Don't judge a book by its cover. Do you know what it's about?
User 1: No, not at all.
User 2: First of all, it's a romance novel, set in the early 19th century.
User 1: I didn't realize it was a romance novel. What's the main storyline?
User 2: It's basically about a father who tried to marry off one of his five girls.
User 1: Why does he want to do that?
User 2: Since he doesn't have a son, he hopes that one of the girls will marry a wealthy man. That way, all of his daughters will be cared for.
User 1: Won't they get his inheritance?
User 2: No, that's the problem. Though they are well-off, once he dies, his house will go to his cousin. So, when he dies, the girls will have nothing.
User 1: I see. This sounds interesting! Maybe my teacher isn't so horrible after all.
User 2: So, are you going to read the novel or watch the movie?

orig:
User 1: Tiffany , why are more and more people turning to the Web to find a mate ?
User 2: I think that , as more people use the Internet for both work and pleasure , it makes more sense as a tool to connect with people , and the stigma of meeting someone online is reduced .
User 1: There are actually special sites for people looking to date within their specific ethnic group and age group . But how should you screen potential mates ? Do you suggest talking to them on the phone right away or communicating via e-mail ?
User 2: I would say do not make the e-mail exchange too long . A lot of times a connection via e-mail creates almost a false sense of intimacy . Quickly make sure there is a connection in the physical world .
User 1: Can you give us any other safety tips for people pursuing relationships on the Net ?
User 2: I'd suggest you not give out too much personal information , like your home address , until after several dates . Just keep up the same guards you would keep up if you were meeting any stranger .
User 1: Besides the growth of these matchmaker sites , do you have any stats on success rates ? Are people out there finding true and lasting love through the Internet
User 2: Well , for a site like ecrush.com , since their debut in Valentine's Day in 1999 , of the 1.5 million people who have joined ecrush.com , 300000 have actually matched .
User 1: Do you have any successful stories to share ?
User 2: Yes , the couple that I highlighted at today's show met on Match.com and they're getting married this summer .

content:
User 1: What do you think of the way people use and treat animals?
User 2: I think most people treat animals well, but we are often cruel to animals. When we raise animals for food, the conditions they live in are often poor.
User 1: Perhaps people should stop eating animals. We could grow more crops.
User 2: What would you do with all the animals? You couldn’t just let them go. Besides, some people would still hunt them. Meat has become an integral part of our diet.
User 1: We could provide them with better conditions anyway. We should certainly try to improve the conditions at zoos. We should try to recreate the natural conditions as much as possible.
User 2: That’s true. I think zoos are a good idea, because they allow people to get close to animals. I think it’s good for kids to see wild animals.
User 1: I agree. I’m an adult and I love going to the zoo. I don’t like animal experiments though. I believe that we can do tests in other ways.
User 2: I read that the number of animals being used in experiments is falling dramatically as new techniques are being introduced.
User 1: That’s good news. The good thing is that most people treat their pets well.
User 2: Sometimes you read about people who have been cruel to pets or other animals, but those stories are rare.
User 1: Have you ever given money to any of the charities that take care of animals?
User 2: Yes, I have. They do an excellent job.

User 1: Hey Sarah , are you all right ? You look upset .
User 2: As a matter of fact , I am a bit upset . I just came out of a meeting and it didn't go very well .
User 1: What happened ?
User 2: No one would listen to any of my suggestions . Instead , they just kept arguing with each other .
User 1: Who was chairing the meeting ?
User 2: Bob .
User 1: Well , I can tell you from experience that Bob might come off a little strong sometimes .
User 2: That's exactly what happened ! He kept interrupting everyone with his own suggestions and did not want to hear what others had to say . Then he expected everyone to agree with him .
User 1: What was the meeting about ?
User 2: We were trying to come up with ideas to streamline the office's workflow to make it more efficient .
User 1: It's ironic that the meeting was anything but efficient .
User 2: Exactly . I had tons of ideas that I wanted to share , but they just wouldn't let me finish . What should I have done to get my point across ?
User 1: You have to keep things short and sweet . When you get a chance to speak , try not to get into too many unnecessary details .
User 2: Short and sweet ? But what if I have to explain something complicated ?
User 1: You can always bring up the main points during the meeting and speak to those who are directly involved after the meeting . Not everyone needs to know all that information .
User 2: That's a good idea , I think I will try that at the next meeting .

content:
User 1: That looks like an interesting book.
User 2: It is. It's got pictures of interesting buildings from all over the world, with brief descriptions of how they were built, their purpose, and so on.
User 1: There are the pyramids. It's easy to see how they got that name! They don't have smooth sides though.

User 1: Look at that cylindrical office building. I've never seen one that shape before.

User 1: TV towers are usually thicker at the bottom than at the top. They're not perfectly cylindrical.

User 2: It says here that it's mainly used for big football matches and athletics meetings.

orig:
User 1: Do you have much experience with kids ?
User 2: Yes . I have three sons . Actually I also have a grandson .
User 1: To tell you the truth , sometimes I regret having a baby so early . I have been making so many sacrifices just because my husband insisted on keeping the baby .
User 2: I understand . I was in your position before . At that time I couldn ’ t depend on anyone taking care of the children for me . My husband seldom stayed at home .
User 1: What about your mother ? Did she help you ?
User 2: Yes , she did a little . But you see , Americans are different from Chinese . You can ’ t depend on your own mother to be a full-time babysitter . She could baby-sit only once or twice a week . That ’ s it . I had to care for them most of the time .
User 1: I see . So if my little family goes to America , I would end up taking care of my child all the time . My husband would have to make the bread for us . I just don ’ t know how I would get some education and be able to get a job some day .
User 2: Don ’ t worry . You can take night classes . I did that when I had kids . And soon your child will be old enough to attend kindergarten . Then you could find a job and work .
User 1: Sounds not so easy to me . When that happens , I will be too old to learn .
User 2: No . You see , I went back to school to get my Master ’ s Degree when I was in my thirties . You won ’ t be older than that .

orig:
User 1: The Spring Festival is drawing close . By then we will have five days off . I am expecting it .
User 2: Can you tell me something about the Spring Festival ?
User 1: Just like you celebrate Christmas , we celebrate our lunar New Year's Day , the Spring Festival . It is a time for the family members and relatives to have a get-together .
User 2: Christmas is also a special time for us to have the family reunion and to express our best wishes to those we love and those who love us in the coming new year .
User 1: Christmas has more religious nature , while our Spring Festival is a more traditional holiday . On the New Year's Eve , we have a big dinner called ' Family Reunion Dinner ' . One of the traditional food to eat at the dinner is dumplings . After that , the adults usually sit chatting , watching TV , or playing cards .
User 2: What are the children doing ?
User 1: They usually go outside to play firecrackers and fireworks .
User 2: I heard one of the purposes to do it is to frighten the devils so they will not come to do any harm to people in the next year .
User 1: Perhaps it is like what people told you . At 24 hours midnight , the time when the New Year really comes , we exchange ' Happy New Year ' to each other , and parents and grandparents will take out small packages wrapped with red paper , in them are some what we call ' Lucky Money .
User 2: Who will get the money ?
User 1: Of course the children .
User 2:

User 1: I've got to put together a sales pitch to give to our clients in the morning . You always give such amazing presentations , I was hoping you could give me some advice about how to win them over tomorrow .
User 2: Sure , it's easy . First of all , the secret to a successful oral presentation is to keep things simple . People are listening and they usually don't have a long attention spans . Stick to about three or four points , give an overview of the points , then present them one by one , and then summarize at the end . Be straightforward and organized and you're sure to be remembered .
User 1: What kind of visuals should I use to support the presentation ? Do you think I should use PowerPoint ?
User 2: You should consider the size and interests of your audience . In other words , who is listening , and what do they want to hear ... you can put together a PPT with some graphics and animations that will catch people's attention , but be careful not to go overboard .
User 1: I think I can put something together , no problem . But when it comes to tomorrow , I'll just be a bundle of nerves ! How can I get over my fear of speaking in public ?
User 2: You know , stage fright is very normal , most people get nervous before they have to speak in front of large groups . Just prepare well , rehearse beforehand , and trust that you will be great ... and you will be !

User 1: Welcome back movie lovers to another Premier Movie Review . My name is Richard Clarke and I am joined today by the very erudite DavidWatson .
User 2: Thank you Dick . Today we are going to talk about the movie Lion King . Tell me Dave , what is your impression of this film ?
User 1: Well , I think this film is simply a fable , depicting man ’ s eternal greed for power , and in my opinion , it ’ s a very fine film . Even despite the accusations of plagiarism traditional folk tales from other countries.The musical score was amazing , the animation was very well done , and the story was simply enchanting .
User 2: I think otherwise . Even though the animation was technically strong , and as you say , the score and songs performed by Elton John were great , the film lacks a certain originality ; it lacked heart . And I would dare to say , it was too predictable .
User 1: Predictable ! How ! Come on Dick , It ’ s a G-rated movie ! It ’ s for the kids ! It ’ s not a thriller !
User 2: Well , that ’ s just it . It did have some very dramatic and intense scenes For example when Mufasal dies , or the dark , grim portrayal of Scar . Even so , the film is linear . Mufasal dies , Simba runs away thinking it ’ s his fault . Falls in love and returns to retake what is rightfully his . It ’ s just too cliche .
User 1: How can it be cliche ? It ’ s a fable ! It ’ s telling a time-honoured story ! The movie make a point of how the hunger for power leads to corruption , and teaches children the value of respect , life and love .
User 2: You have always been so soft , Dave !
User 1: Open your heart Dick . Don ’ t shut us out .
User 2: Anyway ... That ’ s all for today folks ! Join us next time as we talk about & quot , How to lose a guy in 10 days & quot , I ’ m sure you ’ ll love that one Dave !

User 1: do you think there's anything we can do to reverse the damage that's been done already ?
User 2: it might not be possible to fix the problems that we've created for ourselves , but there are lots of things we can do to prevent more damages from happening .

User 2: well , we can use public transport instead of taking our cars for a start .

User 2: if you do have to drive , you should make sure that your car runs on unleaded petrol . Also , your home should use sources of renewable energy .
User 1: how about recycling ? Does that actually help ?
User 2: yes . You should take your glass , paper , plastic , cardboard , and tin cans to a recycling center .
User 1: what do you think is the biggest worry for our future ?
User 2: I think that the issue of greatest concern is having enough sources of clean water for everyone .
User 1: I had no idea you were such as environmentalist before !
User 2: to be honest , in order for the earth to continue to be a habitable place , we're all going to have to become more interested in the environment .

User 1: Alright everyone settle down . Let ’ s get started.As you know , an important aspect of becoming a good citizen is understanding the genesis of our legal system . It is not enough to simply memorize our laws , it is necessary that we comprehend why and how they were formed . This brings me to our topic for today . Does anyone know what we celebrate on May first ?
User 2: Cinct de mayo ?
User 1: No , that ’ s May fifth in Spanish , James , no wonder you are failing my Spanish class . No , May first is International Workers ’ Day .
User 2: Do we get a day off from school then ?
User 1: No ! It is not considered to be a national holiday here in the US , but in other countries it is .
User 2: Www , man !
User 1: In the nineteenth century , working conditions were appalling , with workers being forced to work ten , twelve , and fourteen hours a day . Support for the eight-hour work day movement was growing rapidly , despite the indifference and hostility of many union leaders , and by April 1886 , 250,000 workers were involved in the May Day movement.Previous legislative attempts to improve working conditions had failed , so labor organizers took drastic measures . They passed a resolution stating that eight hours would constitute a legal day ’ s work . And , on May First 1886 , the resolution took effect .
User 2: Cool ! Is that why we only work eight hours now ?
User 1: Yes ! But the happy ending came at a high price.On May third , 1886 , police fired into a crowd of strikers at the McCormick Reaper Works Factory , killing four and wounding many . A mass meeting was called for the next day to protest the brutality .
User 2: And then what happened ?
User 1: Well , as we say , the rest is history ...
