orig:
User 1: I watched a very interesting documentary about plants yesterday evening . It was called “ unusual plants ” and looked at several species of plants from around the world which have unusual features .
User 2: Really ? Tell me about some of the plants they showed .
User 1: Well . There was one type of plant that catches insects and eats them .
User 2: Is that type of plant found in this country ?
User 1: No , it isn ’ t . it ’ s a pity , because I ’ d like to see it in action .
User 2: So would I . what other unusual plants did they show ?
User 1: They showed flowers that only provide their nectar to one type of butterfly or bee . The insect has to be the exact size to get the nectar . Other insects cannot get it . Of course , when the insect collects the nectar , it also takes some pollen from one flower to another .
User 2: That ’ s very specialized . So , the insects and the flowers rely on each other . If one became extinct , the other would too .
User 1: That ’ s right . That ’ s one reason why it ’ s so important to protect every species .
User 2: I see . The plants that fascinate me most are cacti . I find it amazing that they can survive in such dry desert conditions .
User 1: According to the documentary , they have an incredible ability to find water supplies , however small , and then store them without losing much through evaporation .
User 2: That ’ s why they often have long roots to find water spines instead of leaves , to reduce water loss .

orig:
User 1: How do I apply to an American university ?
User 2: You should go to the library to find some information about American universities , and write to the Admission Office . Then the Admission Office will send you application forms and other related materials . From experience , many applicants write to several universities instead of just one .
User 1: I was told that it took a lot of time and effort to apply .
User 2: That is true . I'll list for you the requirements of almost all the universities . First of all , you need official transcripts of your undergraduate work , three letters of recommendation from your professors who know your competence , and the official TOEFL ( Test of English as a Foreign Language ) score ( It's usually 550 ) . Then you need a financial guarantee , and an application fee of 25 dollars .
User 1: What's to come next ?
User 2: If they agree to enroll you , they will send you a TAP - 66 Form . With TAP - 66 , you can apply for a passport from our government , and then apply for a visa from the US Embassy in Beijing .
User 1: How long will it take to go over all the procedures ?
User 2: From 3 to 6 months if everything goes well .
User 1: Thank you . I appreciate all your help .
User 2: You are welcome . Please feel free to ask if you have any more questions .

User 1: Good morning golf aficionados ! My name is Rick Fields , and you guessed it , I am here with my main man , Bob Copeland .
User 2: Thank you , Rick ! As you can see , ladies and gentleman , we are here in beautiful Pebble Beach where the top golfers in the world are trying to win the grand prize of one million dollars !
User 1: Whoa , that ’ s a lot of cash ! Let ’ s go to the course and see how Tiger Woods is doing .
User 2: All right , we are here at the eighth hole . It ’ s a par four , and has some very difficult hazards which many golfers find difficult to avoid . Although , I did see Jack Nicklaus hit a hole in one on this very same hole !
User 1: Tiger Woods is about to tee off , and let ’ s see if he has the same luck as Jack . Tiger is asking his caddie for his driver and , he seems to be very nervous .
User 2: Oh no ! Not a good swing at all ! It ’ s definitely not his day today . On the seventh hole he got a bogey and before that he barely made par . He will definitely not get a birdie on this shot .
User 1: It seems that his ball has flown somewhere deep in the trees . He is having a hard time finding it and even his caddie has climbed a tree to try and spot it .
User 2: Oh no ! A bear ! Run , Tiger , run ! Somebody call animal control !

User 1: Yes , I agree . I think it is a cultural characteristic.It would be very hard to get us Americans to change this.But you know what ? Probably , in the future , Americans will have to change .

User 2: Maybe you're right . They will have to develop alternative transportation.But it will be hard in America . Too many people are used to cars.Even in our movies cars are very important .

Then I usually put in a conditioner and have to rinse that out too . Because my hair is so long , I seldom manage to take a shower in under twenty minutes . Afterwards , I often put on a pot of coffee and get dressed while I wait for it to brew . I take a long time to get dressed in the morning . From time to time I ’ ll put my hair up , butoften times I bloody it straight . And then , because of the texture of my hair , I regularly have to flat-iron it to keep it from frizzing . That ’ s another twenty minutes or so . After that , I have my daily makeup routine .

Then I usually put in a conditioner and have to rinse that out too. Because my hair is so long, I seldom manage to take a shower in under twenty minutes. Afterwards, I often put on a pot of coffee and get dressed while I wait for it to brew. I take a long time to get dressed in the morning. User 1: I heard you were teaching English over there.Tell me about it . Did you like it ?
User 2: Oh , yes , it was very interesting .
User 1: What were the schools like ?
User 2: Oh , I didn't actually teach in the schools . I taught after school . I taught in English institutes .
User 1: But you taught children , yes ?
User 2: Yes . That's right.But children in Taiwan are very different from children in America.At least as far as studying is concerned.Many children in Taiwan go to special institutes after school .
User 1: They actually study after school ?
User 2: That's right.After their school day is over , they go to a special institute to study math or English.They are very serious about learning over there .
User 1: Hmm . That sounds pretty oppressive for the kids . Don't they ever relax ?
User 2: Of course they do.You know , Eliza , before I went over there I thought the same thing . I thought that maybe kids in Taiwan study too much.But now that I've worked there , and taught them , I feel it is a good thing.Their parents are very concerned about their education . More than American parents are . And that is good . American kids don't study enough .
User 1: Asian cultures value learning very much . I know that .
User 2: So it was interesting for me to see parents very concerned about education.They would come to me after the class and ask how their son or daughter was doing . I don't think that's a bad thing . I think it's a good thing.In America , too many parents don't pay attention .
User 1: But aren't the kids tired out ? I mean , they go to school all day , and then they go to school in the evening too .
User 2: As an English teacher , I tried to make the lessons as fun as possible . I tried to have a good time with my classes . The students often enjoyed it.And if the students enjoyed it , they learned more . So it was a good experience .
User 1: Are the kids in Taiwan very obedient ?
User 2: That's a stereotype we Americans have.We think that Asian kids are very obedient and quiet.But it's not true . There are plenty of naughty kids too .
User 1: Hmm . I know you taught in Costa Rica also.Which did you like better--Costa Rica or Taiwan ?
User 2: I don't know . In Costa Rica , I taught adults.So it was a very different thing . So I really can't compare .

orig:
User 1: Excuse me . Can you tell me how to find some books on social science ?
User 2: Sure . You see all these little drawers here and all the way around the walls ?
User 1: Yes .
User 2: These drawers contain cards describing every book in our library . Together they constitute the library's " card catalog " . You can see that each drawer runs from one part of the alphabet to another . Fox example , this drawer goes from SCA to SCM .
User 1: So if I'm looking for a look called A History of Western Society , I'd just look under ' A ' .
User 2: No . You'd look under ' W ' . The articles ' a ' and ' the ' don't count in our alphabetization , and cards are generally omitted for extremely common words and phrases such as ' history of ' , ' introduction to ' , ' story of ' and so forth .
User 1: What if I don't know the title of the book ?
User 2: Well , you can look under the author's name .
User 1: Could you give me an example ?
User 2: Suppose you want to find a book by your professor , William Smith . You'd look under SMITH and then WILLIAM . Since that's very common name , you may have to go through several ' William Smith ' until you come to the one who wrote book on the subject you are interested in .

orig:
User 1: How do I apply to an American university ?
User 2: You should go to the library to find some information about American universities , and write to the Admission Office . Then the Admission Office will send you application forms and other related materials . From experience , many applicants write to several universities instead of just one .
User 1: I was told that it took a lot of time and effort to apply .
User 2: That is true . I ’ ll list for you the requirements of almost all the universities . First of all , you need official transcripts of your undergraduate work , three letters of recommendation from your professors who know your competence , and the official TOEFL ( Test of English as a Foreign Language ) score ( It ’ s usually 550 ) . Then you need a financial guarantee , and an application fee of 25 dollars .
User 1: What's to come next ?
User 2: If they agree to enroll you , they will send you a TAP - 66 Form . With TAP - 66 , you can apply for a passport from our government , and then apply for a visa from the US . Embassy in Beijing .
User 1: How long will it take to go over all the procedures ?
User 2: From 3 to 6 months if everything goes well .
User 1: Thank you . I appreciate your help .
User 2: You are welcome . Please feel free to ask if you have any more questions .

User 1: The Chinese custom is to go to the groom's home-just the opposite .

User 2: Aren't firecrackers forbidden in the city ?
User 1: Well yes , but they are not allowed only in downtown areas . It's OK here . It would be difficult to ban customs that have thousands of years of tradition . The habit does bring kids joy and excitement so long as precautions are taken . Let's go out and set off firecrackers out there .
User 2: Fantastic ! The whole city is echoing with crackling sounds !
User 1: What other activities will you have tomorrow ?
User 2: Quite a lot . The celebration of the New Year has just started . The first day we southerners have sweet rice cakes for breakfast , and people in the North have Jiaozi . Afterward , we will make New Year calls on family relatives , husband's side on the first day and wife's side on the second .
User 1: Do you bring some gifts along ?
User 2: That's for sure . Fruit , cream cakes , medical tonics are often for parents and aged relatives , and cash enclosed in a red envelope for the kids . All this , of course , should be well prepared beforehand .
User 1: Is it the same practice for all families ?
User 2: Not all the same nowadays I must say . Many families , especially those of newly married couples , choose to make an overseas trip to escape the routines . Rose and I had a tour to Singapore , Malaysia , Thailand and Hong Kong last year . We stayed there for two weeks until the last day of the holiday .
User 1: I really appreciate the way you Chinese people exchange feelings . The holiday's long enough for you to relax .
User 2: Well , for city dwellers , the Spring Festival is a holiday of seven days . While in the country where traditions are still heavily emphasized , the festival lasts ten days .

User 2: Really ? Are you OK ?

User 2: If the injury is workplace related I'm sure it's completely covered .
User 1: Hummum ... I think I'll have to talk to the doctor again about that.Anyway ... now that I'm going to have to make some claims , I think I'd better try and understand how the system works . Would you mind breaking it down for me ?
User 2: Sure . Basically we have two insurance policies for employees ... workman's compensation and medical insurance . The company pays the premiums for workman's compensation , and for a significant part of the medical coverage , but you pay part of that premium , too .
User 1: That's the charge for insurance I see on my pay slip each month , right ?
User 2: Yep . Every country in the world has a different system , but here we buy insurance from a private provider .
User 1: So workman's compensation is if I slip and break my arm while working in the office or on the job , right ?
User 2: That's right . The company pays for all your medical bills and there is also some financial compensation if you have to take days off to see doctors or spend time recuperating .

User 2: Of course . What do you want to move first ?
User 1: Let ’ s move the sofa . Can you get a grip on the bottom at that end ? I ’ ll lift this end . I want to move it sideways in that direction .

orig:
User 1: Hey Claire , you've been really quiet these last few days . Is something wrong ?
User 2: I've been really stressed . It's the end of the year and I've got so much stuff to do ! I feel like I'm drowning in work .
User 1: Well , stress is a real thing . It's not an imaginary condition .
User 2: It's seriously affecting my life ! I can't sleep , I don't have much of an appetite and my husband says I've been kind of short tempered . Other people seem to handle stress okay ... why am I so weak ?
User 1: You're not weak ... you're stressed out ! Stress has been a part of the human condition for millions of years . Back when we still lived in the trees we had to watch out for predators ... and as you might imagine , that was pretty stressful .
User 2: Yeah , but I don't see any tigers or leopards roaming around our office . My stress is just about silly paperwork !
User 1: But you're actually having the same reaction as our tree-dwelling ancestors ! It's called the flight or fight response . Each time you feel like something's threatening you , your body decides whether to run away or fight ... it causes all sorts of chemical reactions in the body .
User 2: So a deadline will cause that same reaction ?
User 1: It could . Modern humans actually have more flight or fight responses than our ancestors did . They just had a couple of close calls every day , but today , we have dozens or even hundreds !
User 2: So the life of a cave woman was less stressful than my life ?

User 1: Have you ever thought about having children , Kaitlyn ?
User 2: My husband and I have thought about it , but we ’ Ve decided not to have any . They are just too expensive . Besides , with all the news about global warming on the news lately , who knows what kind of world we ’ ll have in the future . What about you ?
User 1: Well , I ’ Ve always wanted to have lots of children . Growing up with only one brother , I always felt a bit lonely . What do you think about families with only one child ?
User 2: For me , growing up in a big family always made me yearn for attention . I always wanted to be an only child so that I could always do what I wanted and so that I wouldn ’ t ever have to share .
User 1: Don ’ t you think you would miss having other people around ?
User 2: No way ! I spent 20 years of my life with relatives around me 24-7 . you know , I don ’ t think I ’ Ve ever actually spent any time by myself in my parents ’ home . What do you think of the one-child policy in China ?
User 1: If China didn ’ t have such a policy , can you imagine how many people there would be in China now ?
User 2: That ’ s true . But as a woman , I ’ m glad that even though I don ’ t want any children , I at least have a choice in how many children I have . On the other hand , I can ’ t imagine what China would be like if there weren ’ t a one-child policy !
User 1: Do you think most families with many children envy or feel sorry for other families with only one child ?
User 2: I don ’ t know what other people think , but I , for one , envy only children !

User 1: Do you have much experience with kids ?
User 2: Yes . I have three sons . Actually I also have a grandson .
User 1: To tell you the truth , sometimes I regret having a baby so early . I have been making so many sacrifices just because my husband insisted on keeping the baby .
User 2: I understand . I was in your position before . At that time I couldn ’ t depend on anyone taking care of the children for me . My husband seldom stayed at home .
User 1: What about your mother ? Did she help you ?
User 2: Yes , she did a little . But you see , Americans are different from Chinese . You can ’ t depend on your own mother to be a full-time babysitter . She could baby-sit only once or twice a week . That ’ s it . I had to care for them most of the time .
User 1: I see . So if my little family goes to America , I would end up taking care of my child all the time . My husband would have to make the bread for us . I just don ’ t know how I would get some education and be able to get a job some day .
User 2: Don ’ t worry . You can take night classes . I did that when I had kids . And soon your child will be old enough to attend kindergarten . Then you could find a job and work .
User 1: Sounds not so easy to me . When that happens , I will be too old to learn .
User 2: No . You see , I went back to school to get my Master ’ s Degree when I was in my thirties . You won ’ t be older than that .

orig:
User 1: Hello everyone , and welcome to our CPR for beginners course.First of all , does anyone know what CPR stands for ?
User 2: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation !
User 1: That ’ s right ! We apply CPR in the case of cardiac arrest or pulmonary arrest .
User 2: What does that mean ?
User 1: Well , basically if your heart stops pumping blood , or your lungs stop pumping air , then we need to get them going again ! That ’ s when we have to apply this procedure . Let ’ s begin ! I need a volunteer .
User 2: Me ! Me !
User 1: Alright , come here and lay flat on your back . Let ’ s suppose this young woman has stopped breathing . We must lift the person ’ s chin so that we clear a pathway for air to get into the lungs . Then we place our mouth over the other person ’ s mouth and blow air two or three times , like this .
User 2: Wait , what are you doing ? I ’ m a married woman ! You can ’ t just try to kiss me like this !
User 1: Madam I ’ m not trying to kiss you ! I am trying to demonstrate how to apply CPR in the case of an emergency .
User 2: Well , OK . But no French kissing !
User 1: As I was saying , we blow air through the mouth in this manner . Once this is done , we must try to get the heart going again . To do this , we place our hands over the person ’ s chest , and press down firmly two or three times .
User 2: Wait , what are you doing ! You can ’ t just kiss me then go for second base !
User 1:
content:
User 1: Hello everyone, and welcome to our CPR for beginners course. First of all, does anyone know what CPR stands for?
User 2: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation!
User 1: That's right! We apply CPR in the case of cardiac arrest or pulmonary arrest.
User 2: What does that mean?
User 1: Well, basically if your heart stops pumping blood, or your lungs stop pumping air, then we need to get them going again! That's when we have to apply this procedure. Let's begin! I need a volunteer.
User 2: Me! Me!
User 1: Alright, come here and lay flat on your back. Let's suppose this young woman has stopped breathing. We must lift the person's chin so that we clear a pathway for air to get into the lungs. Then we place our mouth over the other person's mouth and blow air two or three times, like this.
User 2: Wait, what are you doing? I'm a married woman! You can't just try to kiss me like this!
User 1: Madam I'm not trying to kiss you! I am trying to demonstrate how to apply CPR in the case of an emergency.
User 2: Well, OK. But no French kissing!
User 1: As I was saying, we blow air through the mouth in this manner. Once this is done, we must try to get the heart going again. To do this, we place our hands over the person's chest, and press down firmly two or three times.
User 2: Wait, what are you doing! You can't just kiss me then go for second base!

User 1: Have you ever thought about your ideal home ?
User 2: I have , actually ; I ’ Ve always wanted to build my dream home myself .
User 1: What would it be like ?
User 2: Well , it would be spacious and located next to a park , because a nice view is important to me .
User 1: How many rooms would it have ?
User 2: I ’ d want it to have three bedrooms on a second floor with balconies on each , and one main bedroom on the main floor with an attached en suite . I ’ d also want a large living room and kitchen connected to each other so that there would be one large open space for people to spend time with each other .
User 1: How many bathrooms would your dream home have ?
User 2: I ’ d have one guest bathroom in the basement , one attached to the main bedroom , and one upstairs , so a total of three .
User 1: How would you decorate your house ?
User 2: I don ’ t like a lot of clutter , so I wouldn ’ t have lots of things out . I would have a few vases on the mantel piece and some pictures of my family on the walls , but other than that , most things would be kept in closets .
User 1: How many TVs would your dream home have ?
User 2: I think TV is a great waste of time , so I would only have one small TV in the kitchen to watch the news in the morning .

User 2: Do people here drink a lot of liquors ?
User 1: Some do , some don't . Many people in the North are fond of liquors . I think it has something to do with the climate .

User 1: Yes , it's a very well-known kind of spirits in Mexico . People drink it with salt and lemon .

User 2: Thank you for telling me so much , I'll try them next time .
User 1: I'm always at your service .

orig:
User 1: So , tell me about you new house . How is it different to your old one ?
User 2: Well , first of all , it ’ s much bigger . It has the same number of rooms , but each room is larger . We also have a larger garden , which our dog loves , of course !
User 1: So , it ’ s a three-bedrooms detached house ?
User 2: Yes . One bedroom is for my wife and I . there ’ s another for our daughter . My wife wants to use the third one as a guest room , but I ’ d like to make it into a study . Our daughter is also keen on making it a study , so that ’ s probably what will happen .
User 1: What ’ s the kitchen like ? I know both you and your wife like to cook .
User 2: That ’ s one of the main reason we chose that particular house . The kitchen and dining room are together . It ’ s really large .
User 1: Are the rooms nice and bright ?
User 2: Yes , they are . That ’ s very important to us . We like to live in a home with plenty of natural light . Each room has large windows .
User 1: Do you have a balcony ?
User 2: No , we don ’ t . We wish we had one . That ’ s the only thing we wanted , but don ’ t have . The area is very nice and the neighbours seem friendly .
User 1: You ’ re right on the edge of the city , aren ’ t you ? There can ’ t be much noise or traffic there . Is it easy to get into city centre ?
User 2: It ’ s a very quiet neighbourhood . There ’ s some traffic , but not much . It ’ s not very difficult to get to the city centre , but you must remember to turn left and right at the right places or you ’ ll get lost . So when are you going to drop by ?

User 1: What ’ s the plot of your new movie ?
User 2: It ’ s a story about a policemen who is investigating a series of strange murders . I play the part of the detective . He has to catch the killer , but there ’ s very little evidence . It ’ s a psychological thriller with some frightening scenes , but I hope audience won ’ t be too scared to go to the movie theatres !
User 1: Did you enjoy making the movie ? We heard stories of disagreement with other actors and with the director .
User 2: I have had disagreement with every director . I ’ Ve worked with . We ’ Ve always disagreed in a friendly way and we have always resolved our differences . It was the same when I made this movie . I don ’ t know where rumours of my disagreement with Rachel Kelly come from . We got on very well and I hope to work with her again . I enjoyed making the movie very much .
User 1: Critics are not very happy with the movies that you ’ Ve made recently . Does that bother you ?
User 2: Not at all . The feedback from audience has been great . I care about what they think more than what the critics think .
User 1: Did you do you own stunts in the movie ?
User 2: I wanted to , but my insurance company wouldn ’ t let me . All of my stunts were done by a stuntman . As you know , I used to do my own stunts , but I ’ ll leave that to the experts in future .
User 1: Thank you very much for doing this interview .
User 2: My pleasure . Have you seen the movie yet ?
User 1: Yes . I have . I liked it very much . Like you , I was very impressed with Rachel ’ s performance in the movie . She ’ s going to be a star .

User 1:
content:
User 1: So, your friend’s getting married on Saturday. What have you bought her as a wedding gift? I find it so hard to choose the right gift.
User 2: My friend and her fiance had a really good idea. They have cut out pictures from catalogues and pasted them in a notebook. The pictures are of things they want. People sign their name.
User 1: That’s clever! Then everyone knows that they are buying something the couple really want and there’s no chance of two people buying the same gift. What things were in the notebook?
User 2: Most of the things were household appliances. You know, everything from an iron through a vacuum cleaner to a cooker. I think it’s an excellent way for everyone who knows the couple to help.
User 1: So, what did you get them?
User 2: I bought a sewing machine. I know that my friend likes making her own clothes, but her current sewing machine is quite old and has some problems.
User 1: What’s wrong with it?
User 2: She says that after several years of use, it’s not working properly. When she uses it, it makes a funny noise.
User 1: Household appliances don’t seem to last for a long time nowadays.
User 2: I think it’s because the manufacturers are constantly bringing out new models. Because they know that we will buy the new models, the appliances don’t need to last more than five or ten years.

User 1: What's wrong ?
User 2: I have a headache . These past few days I've been living off painkillers . Man , I feel like my head is going to explode .
User 1: You should get acupuncture treatment . My mom was always having headache issues and it was acupuncture that cured her .
User 2: The results are too slow . On top of that , just the thought of smoking needles poking into my flesh frightens me .
User 1: They don't just randomly stick you , they find your pressure points . The heat allows the body to immediately respond to the treatment , restoring the body's " chi " .
User 2: But I get scared the moment I see a needle . How could I stand having needles in my body for hours on end ?
User 1: The needles are very thin , and as long as the doctor's technique is good , and the patient himself is relaxed , it won't hurt-on the contrary it will actually alleviate pain . Now there are high-tech needles that are micro thin ; they don't hurt at all . However , if you are really scared of acupuncture , scraping or cupping are also options .
User 2: Scraping is too terrifying . When they finish scrapping , your body is all red , as if you were just tortured . Cupping is the same , your body ends up with red circles all over . It looks like someone beat you up .
User 1: This only signifies that the toxins have left the body . Actually , there is only discomfort during the treatment process . Once it's over you feel very comfortable .
User 2: Chinese medicine is strange . The patients are already ill , and then the doctor makes them suffer more .
User 1: This is the only way to get at the problem . Anyway , if you want to relieve the pain , you are just going to have to be tough and do it .
User 2: Forget it . I don't want to inflict any more pain on myself . In a little while I'll go and buy some more painkillers and take a nap .

User 1: Hello . Can I help you , ma'am ?
User 2: Yes . Could you tell me how to send some money to someone with an account with a bank in Germany ?
User 1: Well , you can pay by mail , telegraphic or SWIFT transfer . Or you can have a banker's draft and mail it yourself to the beneficiary .
User 2: Which is the best way ?
User 1: It depends on the amount and how fast you want that person to receive the money . A SWIFT transfer is the fastest method but a banker's draft is usually the cheapest . How much do you wanna send ?
User 2: $ 800 .
User 1: Why don't you send it by mail payment order ?
User 2: How long does it take ?
User 1: About a week .
User 2: I don't know . Can I send it more quickly ?
User 1: Sure . You can have a Telegraphic or a SWIFT transfer .
User 2: And how long do those take ?
User 1: Both a Telegraphic Transfer and a SWIFT transfer will normally be credited to the payee's account within three or four working days , depending on whether the beneficiary's bank is among our correspondent banks or we have to route the transfer through a third bank .
User 2: I see . How can I pay by Telegraphic Transfer ?
User 1: You have to fill out this form , ma'am .

User 2: Yes . I've read it carefully .
User 1: And do you have any questions ?
User 2: No . But the contract stipulates that I will teach 22 hours a week.Will you have thatmany classes for me right away ?
User 1: No , probably not . For the first two weeks you may teach 10 or 15 hours .
User 2: But my salary will be 1100 dollars a month.Will you pay me that much for the first month ? Because , I mean , I won't be working so many hours .
User 1: I understand . That's why I didn't write the date on the contract.For the first two weeks , we will pay you according to the hours you teach.When you have 22 hours of classes , then the contract will take effect.Is that alright with you ?
User 2: Oh , so I don't sign the contract today . Is that right ?
User 1: I don't want you to misunderstand , Miss Briggs.We are very serious about hiring you . We want you to teach for us.We usually do contracts this way because it is more convenient .
User 2: I can accept that .
User 1: Good . And your benefits will begin immediately .
User 2: Even my health insurance ?
User 1: Yes . We will apply for your health insurance tomorrow.And your free membership in the club starts today if you like .
User 2: I have a few questions about the free membership .
User 1: What would you like to know ?
User 2: Is my membership the same as paying club members ? I mean , can I get discounts at club hotels ?
User 1: Absolutely . The only difference is in the restaurant and bar vouchers .
User 2: What are bar vouchers ?
User 1: Paying club members get around 300 dollars a year in restaurant vouchers.The vouchers can be used in the restaurant or the lounge.But we don't offer vouchers to employees .
User 2: But according to the contract , employees get a discount in the restaurant .

orig:
User 1: I've been learning to play go recently . It's an amazing game !
User 2: Weigh ? It must be a greatest Chinese invention . I've tried hard to learn it . Its rules can't be any simpler , but I've never won a game of Go . Well , it's all Greek to me !
User 1: At least you have obtained a very basic understanding of the game , haven't you ? I think it is perfect for boosting intelligence , cultivating personality and flexible learning . Every intellectual wishing to gain any insight into Chinese culture should learn to play Go .
User 2: I heard it is included in the four major arts of China , is it ?
User 1: Sure . It was considered desirable that a well-educated ancient Chinese scholar could be well versed in zither , weigh , calligraphy and painting . I think weigh is the most fantastic of them . It embodies ancient Chinese wisdom and cultural profoundness .
User 2: I know it is quite different from Western chess .
User 1: Yes . Playing chess is a very aggressive experience . All the pieces are supposed to capture their opponents . Whenever I start a chess game , I can't help but imagine a concrete battle in which all fighters stand ready to kill .
User 2: But isn't it the same with wiki ?
User 1: Certainly not . The object of weigh is to surround a larger area than the opponent . In other words , each side is struggling for a greater living space by mapping out a territory on the board . Hence , chess aims to kill , while weigh is most concerned with howso survive .

User 2: I heard it is included in the four major arts of China, is it?
User 1: Sure. It was considered desirable that a well-educated ancient Chinese scholar could be well versed in zither, Go, calligraphy and painting. I think Go is the most fantastic of them. It embodies ancient Chinese wisdom and cultural profoundness.
User 2: I know it is quite different from Western chess.

User 2: But isn't it the same with Go?
User 1: Certainly not. The object of Go is to surround a larger area than the opponent. In other words, each side is struggling for a greater living space by mapping out a territory on the board. Hence, chess aims to kill, while Go is most concerned with how to survive.

User 1: Melanie , can you help me with something ? We need to finalize the account with the Mexican Embassy and , I need some advice on phrasing this letter correctly in English .
User 2: Sure Tracy , let me just get my laptop .
User 1: Okay , so ... To Whom It May Concern , I am writing .
User 2: Um , Tracy ? I think that ' s a little too formal . I know you want to be polite but you've already made contact with them , so in English you can be more relaxed in the opening ...
User 1: Okay , more relaxed . Got it . Hey , Sally , what ' s up ? It's Tracy here , just .
User 2: Okay Tracy , now it's too relaxed ! You've still got to show some respect . How about starting with " Dear Ms . Cooper , I'm writing to confirm ... ?
User 1: Great , okay . " Dear Miss Cooper , I'm writing to confirm the final quotation for the full page back cover color advertisement you requested for the spring issue of Voila magazine " .
User 2: That's great ...
User 1: " The final costing , including advert design and production , comes to forty-five thousand six hundred RIB . We want payment ten working days before publication or we will cancel the ad . Thanks for ... "
User 2: Woo , okay , back up a second , Tracy . That's too direct . Can I suggest you say , please note that final payment is due two working weeks before publication ? You don't want to offend her .
User 1: Oops , okay . You are right . Then I can just end with " All the best , Tracy " .
User 2: Mmmm , maybe , but I'd play it safe and just finish with " Yours Sincerely " . That's more professional .
User 1: Oh , Melanie , you are a life saver , thank you !
User 2:

User 1: We've got a problem ... it looks like we'll need more spotlights on the exhibition booth . The client thinks it's too dark , and they want to add halogen lighting . We've already got 3 sets of track lighting from you guys , do you think you could help us out and throw in some halogens ?
User 2: Oh ... Um ... I don't think so . you know the halogen lighting is much more expensive than your track lighting system . Plus I'm going to have to call in some guys to install it for you . That's not going to come cheap .
User 1: But it would only be adding to the existing structure . We're not talking about anything new here ...
User 2: It doesn't matter because we will still have to call the electrician out , and they are union labor . It'll cost you a pretty penny ...
User 1: How much do you think it would cost ?
User 2: Mumm , I estimate it'll run in the neighborhood of ... $ 500 per light .
User 1: $ 500per light ? ! That's ridiculous ! It can't possibly be that expansive !
User 2: It is , I'll tell you why . We'll have to call in the electrician , he's going to charge overtime now because it's already 5PM , and it will probably take him an hour a light . Plus , the halogen lights take more electricity , so your electrical cost is going to be higher as well .
User 1: Can't you give me a break on this ? We've already spent so much money on lighting , I hate to have to blow so much more on halogens .
User 2: No , that's the cost , and that's what it's going to cost us . We can't go in the hole with this . I am giving you my best price , so take it , or leave it .

User 1: Can you suggest a few exercise to help me get fit and stretch my muscles a little ?
User 2: Sure . If you want to stretch your legs , a good exercise is to lift your knee in front of your body , like this . It ’ s a very simple exercise , but very effective .
User 1: I need to excise my arms too . How can I do that ?
User 2: One good way is to do push-ups . Another way is to use weights . Make sure you grip the weights firmly . You don ’ t want to drop them on your feet !
User 1: When I do push-ups , should I bend my elbows so that my nose touches the ground ?
User 2: You don ’ t need to bend your elbows that much . Bend them so that your arms are at a 90 degree angle . The most important think is to remember to keep your body straight . Many people bend their bodies at the waist , which reduces the effectiveness of the exercise .
User 1: What ’ s a good exercise for my chest muscles ?
User 2: One that I recommend is that you lie on your back . You should have a weight in each hand and stretch your arms out either side of your body .
User 1: So I need plenty of space for this exercise .
User 2: Yes , you do . Lift the weight up , keeping your arms straight all the time .
User 1: Great . Thanks for you advice !

orig:
User 1: What's your ideal boss ?
User 2: I have had an incredible boss , who was my direct supervisor during the last year of my coop work experience . A-bout two months after I began working for her , she really let me spread my wings . She encouraged me to work independently , because she said she had come to trust my judgment and commitment . So I was able to move forward on projects without having to check in with her every day . Of course , I made certain that she knew what I had accomplished on a daily and weekly basis because I gave her summary reports , although she didn't specifically ask me to . Without her support and encouragement , I don't think I would have felt confident enough to have written up a proposal suggesting that the department change a process that had been in place for a long time . But she was open to suggestions , so long as employees could back them up with research and facts . When I submitted my suggestion , she reviewed it and told me where she thought it needed more work . She then took my revised proposal to her boss . He was a more conservative type , but she lobbied him to try It for several weeks . He did , and it was so successful that it was instituted as a permanent change . I've also worked for some very difficult bosses in summer and part-time jobs . And while I'd certainly prefer to work for one like I've just described , I'm the kind of person who can get along with just about anyone .
User 1:
content:
User 1: What's your ideal boss?
User 2: I have had an incredible boss, who was my direct supervisor during the last year of my coop work experience. About two months after I began working for her, she really let me spread my wings. She encouraged me to work independently, because she said she had come to trust my judgment and commitment. So I was able to move forward on projects without having to check in with her every day. Of course, I made certain that she knew what I had accomplished on a daily and weekly basis because I gave her summary reports, although she didn't specifically ask me to. Without her support and encouragement, I don't think I would have felt confident enough to have written up a proposal suggesting that the department change a process that had been in place for a long time. But she was open to suggestions, so long as employees could back them up with research and facts. When I submitted my suggestion, she reviewed it and told me where she thought it needed more work. She then took my revised proposal to her boss. He was a more conservative type, but she lobbied him to try it for several weeks. He did, and it was so successful that it was instituted as a permanent change. I've also worked for some very difficult bosses in summer and part-time jobs. And while I'd certainly prefer to work for one like I've just described, I'm the kind of person who can get along with just about anyone.

User 1: Jane ! What an enchanting skirt you have on !
User 2: Thank you ! Guess how much it costs .
User 1: Bright colors , smooth material , exquisite craftsmanship , soft lines ... Darling , it looks elegant on you ! It can't be any cheap stuff . Something around two hundred , I guess .
User 2: Your offer is way off the mark . It set me back only sixty-five .
User 1: Then you got a windfall ! Was sixty-five the original price , or did you get a special discount ?
User 2: Neither . I drove a hard bargain with the vendor before I got the price down .
User 1: How much did she ask for ?
User 2: Three hundred ! That's daylight robbery . How dare she play tricks on an old hand like me ? Without hesitation , I gave my offer---no more than fifty .
User 1: She must be fuming with anger at such a bid , wasn't she ?
User 2: Not at all ! She's really been around , and seemed quite accustomed to bargaining like this . That's the trade . She only demanded a higher bid , saying the purchase price was even higher than seventy . She was lying ! Then I inquired , ' May I have it at sixty ? ' she waved her head .
User 1: Then you pretended to go without buying it ?
User 2: Yeah . I turned around and started to move out . Just then , she yelped behind my back , ' all right , all right ! I may sacrifice a little . Let's fix it sixty-five ! Can't be cheaper . '

User 1: So , Emily , how was your day ?
User 2: I don't think you really want to hear about it .
User 1: It can't have been that bad . Go on and tell me about it .
User 2: To be honest , it was horrible ! My manager is such a pain in the neck !
User 1: Why ? What happened ?
User 2: Well , he made quite a few mistakes on the monthly report and when his supervisor found them , my manager blamed them on me !
User 1: That's not very fair . What did you do ?
User 2: There wasn't really anything that I could do . There's always been a lot of bad blood between my manager and myself . If I had said anything , he would have fired me for sure .
User 1: Does he treat everyone in your department like this ?
User 2: He treats everyone pretty badly , but the way he treats me really takes the cake !
User 1: Do you have any idea why he treats you worse than the others ?
User 2: I really have no idea . All I know is that the thought of him really curls my hair !
User 1: Is there anyone else you can talk to about it at your company ?
User 2: Not really . I'm hoping to live with it for a while until I get a promotion .
User 1: That's very sensible . It sounds like you have a good head on your shoulders .
User 2: I try to be sensible about it , but it's not very easy . Sometimes you just have to grin and bear it .
User 1: That's so true . When you have a taste for success , you can't let dishonest people like your manager get in the way .

User 2: Pleased to see you , too , Mr . Brown .

User 2: Yes , a very pleasant journey , thank you .
User 1: It's been a full two years since we last saw each other .
User 2: So it is , I've come again to renew our sole agency agreement for another 2 years .
User 1: We shall be pleased to talk the matter over with you . You've done very well in fulfilling the agreement .
User 2: I'm glad you're satisfied with our work . I can assure you we've spared no effort and spent quite a sum of money in pushing the sales of your products .
User 1: Yes , we appreciate your efforts in pushing the sales of our pianos . We can see you are experienced in this particular line .
User 2: Thank you .
User 1: But I think the annual sale of 300 pianos for a sole distributorship in Canada is rather conservative . After all , you sold around 400 pieces there last year . You can sell more this year according to the marketing conditions at your end .
User 2: That is the result of our hard work . Well , what annual quantity would you suggest for the new agreement then ?
User 1: 500 pieces .
User 2: No , no . That's too big a number to be acceptable . Let's put it at 450 pieces . And we'll strive to sell more , of course . We wish to add another clause . For every 50 pieces sold in excess of the quota , we'll get 1 % more in commission for our efforts .
User 1: All right , let's fix it at 450 pieces then . And for every additional 50 pianos sold , we'll give you 1 % higher commission .
User 2: I suppose all the other terms remain unchanged .

orig:
User 1: Hello everyone , and welcome to our CPR for beginners course . First of all , does anyone know what CPR stands for ?
User 2: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation !
User 1: That ’ s right ! We apply CPR in the case of cardiac arrest or pulmonary arrest .
User 2: What does that mean ?
User 1: Well , basically if your heart stops pumping blood , or your lungs stop pumping air , then we need to get them going again ! That ’ s when we have to apply this procedure . Let ’ s begin ! I need a volunteer .
User 2: Me ! Me !
User 1: Alright , come here and lay flat on your back . Let ’ s suppose this young woman has stopped breathing . We must lift the person ’ s chin so that we clear a pathway for air to get into the lungs . Then we place our mouth over the other person ’ s mouth and blow air two or three times , like this .
User 2: Wait , what are you doing ? I ’ m a married woman ! You can ’ t just try to kiss me like this !
User 1: Madam I ’ m not trying to kiss you ! I am trying to demonstrate how to apply CPR in the case of an emergency .
User 2: Well , OK . But no French kissing !
User 1: As I was saying , we blow air through the mouth in this manner . Once this is done , we must try to get the heart going again . To do this , we place our hands over the person ’ s chest , and press down firmly two or three times .
User 2: Wait , what are you doing ! You can ’ t just kiss me then go for second base !
User 1:
content:
User 1: Hello everyone, and welcome to our CPR for beginners course. First of all, does anyone know what CPR stands for?
User 2: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation!
User 1: That's right! We apply CPR in the case of cardiac arrest or pulmonary arrest.
User 2: What does that mean?
User 1: Well, basically if your heart stops pumping blood, or your lungs stop pumping air, then we need to get them going again! That's when we have to apply this procedure. Let's begin! I need a volunteer.
User 2: Me! Me!
User 1: Alright, come here and lay flat on your back. Let's suppose this young woman has stopped breathing. We must lift the person's chin so that we clear a pathway for air to get into the lungs. Then we place our mouth over the other person's mouth and blow air two or three times, like this.
User 2: Wait, what are you doing? I'm a married woman! You can't just try to kiss me like this!
User 1: Madam I'm not trying to kiss you! I am trying to demonstrate how to apply CPR in the case of an emergency.
User 2: Well, OK. But no French kissing!
User 1: As I was saying, we blow air through the mouth in this manner. Once this is done, we must try to get the heart going again. To do this, we place our hands over the person's chest, and press down firmly two or three times.
User 2: Wait, what are you doing! You can't just kiss me then go for second base!
User 1:

User 1: do you remember where you were for the terrorist attacks on 9-11 ?
User 2: yes , I was in my apartment in Beijing . Where were you ?
User 1: I was at home with my parents in New York City .
User 2: really ? Did you see the hijacked planes crash into and destroy the twin towers ?
User 1: I didn't see the crash itself , but I did see the smoke and everything afterwards from my parents ' apartment building .
User 2: that must have been horrible . Did you go out at all that day to see what was going on ?
User 1: no , we decided to stay in our apartment . With all the buses out of service and the underground trains at a halt , many people had no choice but to walk home . It was utter chaos .
User 2: did you know anyone who worked in the World Trade Center ?
User 1: yes , my uncle's firm had an office in one of the towers .
User 2: did he survive ?
User 1: unfortunately , he wasn't able to evacuate in time . He ended up dying in the tower .
User 2: I'm sorry . That must have really been a nightmarish day for you and your family .
User 1: it was . The hijackers didn't have any respect for human life not even their own .
User 2: terrorist acts are deliberate and deadly and can affect every walk of life .

User 2: Kindergarten students usually only go to school for about four hours every day , but after that , they spend about eight hours in school every day .
User 1: do they have to go to school on Saturdays ?
User 2: no , most children in America only go to school Monday through Friday .
User 1: how many subjects do they have to study ?
User 2: In most schools , they study about nine subjects .

User 2: I went to a private school for elementary school and university , but went to a public school for high school . What about you ?

User 2: did you have to wear uniforms ?
User 1: yes , they were horrible . We had to wear green every day !
User 2: at least you didn't waste time thinking about what you were going to wear every day !
User 1: that's true !

User 1: Great idea ! As long as I don't get food poisoning ! So what is on the menu tonight ?
User 2: Ok , for starters we have Tom Yam soup . It's a bit spicy , but really good !
User 1: This is delicious ! The ginger and lemongrass really gives it a nice taste !
User 2: Now this next dish is one of the most famous . Foreigners call it papaya salad but the proper name is Tom Sam . It is a spicy salad made from a mix of fresh vegetables including shredded unripened papaya and tomato .
User 1: This is delicious ! The combination of sour and spicy is really interesting ! I could have this everyday !
User 2: Ok , now for the last and best dish in my opinion . This is called Pad Thai . It's stir-fried noodles with eggs , fish sauce , tamarind juice , red chili pepper plus bean sprouts , shrimp and tofu and garnished with crushed peanuts and coriander . It's practically Thailand's national dish !
User 1: Wow , this is great ! I never knew Thai food was so creative and delicious !
User 2: Want some more ?
User 1: I'm stuffed !

User 2: You can just put Dear Sir or Madam , officialese not personal , you can write to whom may concerned .
User 1: OK , So I first thanks them for their business , I can say something like we are very grateful for your continue support , How is that ?
User 2: Good ! But also , write off the bed you want to tell them the reason of your writing , give them more reference .

User 2: You can tell them " Please finding the enclosed customer service survey , else also , you can say Attach a customer survey . User 1:
content:
User 1: Can you help me for a minute?
User 2: Sure, what can I do for you?
User 1: I'm trying to write a letter to one of our clients, but I just don't know exactly what to say. I don't even know how to get started. I know I should write dear Mr., Mrs., or Ms., but the problem is I don't know the name of the contact person.
User 2: You can just put Dear Sir or Madam, it's official, not personal. You can write to whom it may concern.
User 1: OK, so I first thank them for their business. I can say something like we are very grateful for your continued support. How is that?
User 2: Good! But also, right off the bat, you want to tell them the reason for your writing, give them more reference.
User 1: Like, regarding our new product line, we would like to announce a special price discount.
User 2: Right, do you need them to respond?
User 1: Yes, the letter would have a survey inside, and they should complete it and return to our office. How should I write that?
User 2: You can tell them "Please find the enclosed customer service survey". Else also, you can say "Attach a customer survey". If you need a response right away, you can tell them the urgency by saying "Please return the survey without delay as soon as possible". Make it more polite with this: "at your earliest convenience".

User 1: Since China was open to the outside world , its trade forms have become much more flexible . One of these commonly used forms is co-production . Would you please do a bit explanation of it , Mr . Walker ?
User 2: Well , under this arrangement two parties cooperate to manufacture a product or a category of products , for example , machine tools for export . Each party produces and supplies a part of the components and parts ; one party is a Chinese enterprise , the other , an overseas firm . Most probably , the foreign counterpart contributes technology and equipment , and sometimes , parts and components , while the Chinese enterprises factory building , labor and other resources to the cooperative production . They join hands and fulfill orders together by an agreement or a contract .
User 1: I suppose that the assembling of these components and parts , particularly the marketing of the finished products should take place in China .
User 2: Not necessarily . It depends on the contract stipulations . They may be marketed in the foreign country where the other party is located , or even in a third country .
User 1: I think the principle of co-production is to expand export trade . It's a reciprocal business , isn't it ?
User 2: Yes , you are right . Either party is not well-equipped to produce the final products single-handedly , but they can enter into an agreement . In such case , each side contributes different resources to make the manufacture of a certain product or a category of products possible .
User 1:
content:
User 1: Since China was open to the outside world, its trade forms have become much more flexible. One of these commonly used forms is co-production. Would you please do a bit explanation of it, Mr. Walker?
User 2: Well, under this arrangement two parties cooperate to manufacture a product or a category of products, for example, machine tools for export. Each party produces and supplies a part of the components and parts; one party is a Chinese enterprise, the other, an overseas firm. Most probably, the foreign counterpart contributes technology and equipment, and sometimes, parts and components, while the Chinese enterprises factory building, labor and other resources to the cooperative production. They join hands and fulfill orders together by an agreement or a contract.
User 1: I suppose that the assembling of these components and parts, particularly the marketing of the finished products should take place in China.
User 2: Not necessarily. It depends on the contract stipulations. They may be marketed in the foreign country where the other party is located, or even in a third country.
User 1: I think the principle of co-production is to expand export trade. It's a reciprocal business, isn't it?
User 2: Yes, you are right. Either party is not well-equipped to produce the final products single-handedly, but they can enter into an agreement. In such case, each side contributes different resources to make the manufacture of a certain product or a category of products possible.

orig:
User 1: Did you working in a similar position before ?
User 2: Yes . I have been with ABC Insurance Company for four years , and before that , I worked with the Pacific surveyor company as claim officer .
User 1: Could you tell me the usual procedures to handle such a case ?
User 2: Yes , on the shipper's side , when the cargos arrives , all relevant documents will be forwarded to the consignee.Among other things , this party has to check carefully the content of the packing list and weight list.When cargos are found to be damaged of short landed , this party has to call for a joint survey by representatives of the shipping company and the insurance agent.Based on the survey report , they will lodge a clam for compensation .
User 1: If you act as our representative what would you do to safeguard our interest ?
User 2: I think , first of all , I would ask the consignee to produce survey report on loading , if they can't produce that I would suggest them to refer the case to their shipper . Meanwhile , bad weather could be agood excuse to refuse the responsibility .
User 1: Are you able to operate the telex ?
User 2: Yes , I used to dispatch telex to shippers and the consignee to inform them of changes of our schedule and other information .
User 1: Now can you tell me if you have a good command of both written and spoken English ?
User 2: When I was college , I passed Band Six of College English Test.All the foreign business men I've dealt with say my English is quite good .
User 1: If you are selected for the position , you must prepare to travel overseas frequently .
User 2: No problem , I love it.Thank you for granting me the interview .
User 1:
content:
User 1: Did you work in a similar position before?
User 2: Yes. I have been with ABC Insurance Company for four years, and before that, I worked with the Pacific Surveyor Company as a claim officer.
User 1: Could you tell me the usual procedures to handle such a case?
User 2: Yes, on the shipper's side, when the cargo arrives, all relevant documents will be forwarded to the consignee. Among other things, this party has to check carefully the content of the packing list and weight list. When cargo is found to be damaged or short landed, this party has to call for a joint survey by representatives of the shipping company and the insurance agent. Based on the survey report, they will lodge a claim for compensation.
User 1: If you act as our representative what would you do to safeguard our interest?
User 2: I think, first of all, I would ask the consignee to produce a survey report on loading, if they can't produce that I would suggest them to refer the case to their shipper. Meanwhile, bad weather could be a good excuse to refuse the responsibility.
User 1: Are you able to operate the telex?
User 2: Yes, I used to dispatch telex to shippers and the consignee to inform them of changes in our schedule and other information.
User 1: Now can you tell me if you have a good command of both written and spoken English?
User 2: When I was in college, I passed Band Six of the College English Test. All the foreign businessmen I've dealt with say my English is quite good.
User 1: If you are selected for the position, you must prepare to travel overseas frequently.
User 2: No problem, I love it. Thank you for granting me the interview.

User 1: Well , we've settled the question of price , quality and quantity . Now what about the terms of payment ?
User 2: We only accept payment by irrevocable letter of credit payable against shipping documents .
User 1: I see . Could you make an exception and accept D / A or D / P ?
User 2: I'm afraid not . We insist on a letter of credit .
User 1: To tell you the truth , a letter of credit would increase the cost of my import . When I open a letter of credit with a bank , I have to pay a deposit . That'll tie up my money and increase my cost .
User 2: Consult your bank and see if they will reduce the required deposit to a minimum .
User 1: Still , there will be bank charges in connection with the credit . It would help me greatly if you would accept D / A or D / P . You can draw on me just as if there were a letter of credit . It makes no great difference to you , but it does to me .
User 2: Well , Mrs . Wang , you must be aware that an irrevocable letter of cred it gives the exporter the additional protection of the bank er's guarantee . We always require L / C for our exports . And the other way round , we pay by L / C for our imports .
User 1: To meet you half way , what do you say if 50 % by L / C and the balance by D / P ?
User 2: I'm very sorry , Mrs . Wang . But I'm afraid I can't promise you even that . As I've said , we require payment by L / C .

User 2: I never really give them money because I don't want to contribute to their addictions .
User 1: homeless youth can easily become involved with drugs and prostitution . Do you do anything to help them ?
User 2: I usually ask them if they want some food and then give them something to eat . I figure that if they're homeless , they're probably hungry .
User 1: that's a good idea . Do they usually accept the food ?
User 2: almost always . However , sometimes they get mad at me for not giving them any cash .
User 1: it's sad how more and more young people are sleeping on the streets in London now .
User 2: the cost of living in London is just too high for most people .
User 1: it's true . The economy is in a bit of mess at the moment .
User 2: did you know that few people can pay the rent on minimum wage , let alone pay for food and other living costs ?
User 1: there just isn't enough affordable housing to go around . If only the housing cost would drop , fewer people would be in financial trouble .
User 2: added to that is the high unemployment rate right now .
User 1: something's got to change---and it's got to happen soon .
User 2: politicians like to ignore the problems of the working class . They like to focus on making life easier for the upper class .
User 1: I can only hope that one day they will change .

orig:
User 1: What did you do at the office today ?
User 2: I had a really busy day . I had to work a little overtime . In the morning an important client called to place a large order . I had to check some things with my colleagues before confirming the order .
User 1: What kind of things did you need to check ?
User 2: The most important thing was to check that we had the goods in stock . If the goods are in stock , we can deliver them immediately . I also had to check the price . This customer is very important , so they get special prices .
User 1: I see . Did anything else happen ?
User 2: I received a lot of emails from potential clients that I had to answer . Each time , I had to check files to see what we had agreed at earlier meetings . Each client has different conditions and requirements .
User 1: It must be difficult to remember the details for each individual client .
User 2: Yes . That ’ s why we have everything on computer files . We don ’ t use much paper at our office . After lunch , I had to deal with a complaint from a client .
User 1: I hate dealing with complaints . Was it a legitimate complaint ?
User 2: Yes , it was . I managed to sort out the problem , but I was tied up with the matter for over an hour .
User 1: You certainly had a busy day .
User 2: That ’ s not all ! I also had to finish writing a sales report for my boss . In the end , I finished everything . I wonder what will be waiting for me tomorrow morning .

orig:
User 1: Hey , Robert , that's a nice shirt you are wearing . Where did you get it ?
User 2: Thanks , I like it too . I bought it at the nearby department store .
User 1: That's nice . Do you know you can get one at the wholesale market near the zoo for a much lower price ?
User 2: Yeah , I know that . But at those places . the prices they ask you are ridiculously high , and if you don't bargain hard , you will get ripped-off .
User 1: True , learning how to haggle the price is one of the things people have to pick up when they come to China for the first time .
User 2: Yeah , but personally I hate bargaining . If I bargain , I might come to a lower price . But I will never know the true price of what I am buying , and I'll always have the feeling that I am over charged at those places .
User 1: Yeah , I have the same feeling . Also there is another thing that bothers me the quality . Things in a department store are usually quality-guaranteed . But at a wholesale market , you never know whether what you are buying are of good quality or not .
User 2: That's why I like department stores more . Shopping at a wholesale market like the locals is one of the few things I am unable to grow accustomed to .
User 1: I understand . While it's always good to follow the local customs , I guess there are exceptions .
User 2:

orig:
User 1: Did you enjoy your weekend at the highland hotel ? I heard it ’ s and excellent place to stay and has good facilities .
User 2: I had a wonderful time . The rooms are not very big , but they are well furnished . The restaurant is excellent and reasonably priced . There ’ s a sauna and a Jacuzzi .
User 1: Do they have a swimming pool ?
User 2: No , they don ’ t . they have a beauty parlor , but I didn ’ t go there .
User 1: What ’ s the service like ?
User 2: It ’ s very good . Check in and check out at the reception only took a few minutes . The wait staff is very good . A waiter recommended their baked fish , which tasted wonderful . The hotel was quite full , so I ’ d suggest making a reservation if you intend to go there . The hotel offers a discount at the weekends .
User 1: It sounds perfect . Did you have any complaints at all ?
User 2: There was a problem with the internet access , so I couldn ’ t check my email , but I didn ’ t complain about it to the management .
User 1: I suppose you were happy to forget about the outside world .
User 2: Yes , I was . Here ’ s their business card .
User 1: Thanks . Was there a mina bar in the room ?
User 2: No , there wasn ’ t . There is a bar on the ground floor and of course you can buy drinks in the restaurant to go with your meal .
User 1: One of the things I dislike about hotels is that everyone expects tips .
User 2: I know . At the inland hotel , they have an interesting policy . When you check out , you put some money in a special box at reception . Each evening , the money in the box is shared equally by the hotel staff .

User 2: Thanks a lot . My wife and I will be welcoming and looking forward to your visit .
User 1: Let's call it a deal . Hope to see you again soon . Keep in touch then . Byebye .
User 2: Goodbye . Thanks again .

orig:
User 1: Good morning , my name is Martin . You've applied for the Laboratory Assistant's position , right ?
User 2: Yes . When I saw the advertisement I thought it would really suit me .
User 1: Can you tell me why you replied to our advertisement ?
User 2: I think that I'll be really good at this kind of work . In fact I learn so fast that I'll be looking for promotion very shortly .
User 1: Do you know exactly what you would be doing as a Laboratory Assistant ?
User 2: A laboratory assistant helps to maintain scientific equipment , keep a check on the supplies in the store , and prepare the chemicals for experiments .
User 1: What sort of student do you regard yourself as ? Did you enjoy studying while you were at school ?
User 2: I suppose I'm a reasonable student . I passed all my tests and enjoyed studying subjects that interested me .
User 1: What were your favorite subjects at school ?
User 2: Maths and chemistry were my favorite subjects at school . I also enjoyed history .
User 1: Do you have any plans for further study ?
User 2: Well , I've thought about doing the part-time Chemistry Certificate course at Technical College . I think I would really benefit from doing that .
User 1: Have you ever had a job before ?
User 2: Yes . I have worked part-time at a take away food store-the one just round the corner .
User 1: We have a lot of other applicants for this position . Why do you think that you deserve to get the job ?
User 2: Well , I've found out a lot about this type of work and my research suggests that I would be quite capable of doing the work involved . I also think that I would be able to handle any training course reasonably well .
User 1: I think I have asked you everything I wanted to . Thank you for coming along to the interview .
User 2: Thank you . When will I know if I am successful ?
User 1: We'll be in touch with you by telephone or by mail within a week . Well . Goodbye .
User 2: Goodbye .

User 2: I can't agree more , honey . We need to get away from work from time to time .
User 1: Yeah , just return to nature and feel the thrills of its beauty .
User 2: We are nor alone here . So many other families !
User 1: Sure . The sunny days of spring are ideal for outdoor gatherings .
User 2: Well , let's go over there and put a blanket on the lawn .
User 1: OK , you go back to our car and fetch the picnic stuff .
User 2: Oh , so heavy ! What have you put in here ?
User 1: Nothing special . Food , drinks , and Daniel's kangaroo toys .
User 2: Toys ? Why do we need toys for a picnic ?
User 1: He said he would like to be our tour director and he lined up many things to do .
User 2: Sure , then . May it really be a day of enjoyment . Other than that , we can also teach him something about science .
User 1: Science ? What are you talking about ? Forget about your science , OK ? It's a picnic !
User 2: I mean we can inspire him for a deeper understanding of the natural world .
User 1: I can't agree on that . Just cut it out . Give him a break and don't spoil the day .
User 2: Well , OK . you are always right .

User 1: Are you still coming to my place for dinner tomorrow night ?
User 2: Of course . Is the dinner still on ?
User 1: Yes , I was just wondering how you and your roommate were planning on coming to my place .
User 2: We were planning on walking both ways since the weather is still nice .
User 1: That's what I thought you would do . Listen , I live in a bit of a rough neighborhood . It's just down the street from all the bars . You probably don't want to be walking around after dark .
User 2: It can't be that bad .
User 1: I wish it wasn't , but there is actually a lot of crime and prostitution around here .
User 2: Really ? I never would have guessed . The criminals must only come out in the evenings , because I've never noticed anything strange when I've been at your house in the daytime .
User 1: Do me a favor , and take a taxi . It'd make me feel a lot better .
User 2: Ok , we will . How do you get around in the evenings ?
User 1: When I first moved in , I walked everywhere . But within a week , I had my purse stolen — just a block away from the police station ! Now , I always take public transportation .
User 2: Has anything else happened to you ?
User 1: Nothing else has happened to me , but I have seen quite a few fights on the streets after the bars close .
User 2: Well , we'll be careful . Thanks for letting me know .

User 1: What else should we do now after the floors are done and after the furniture is in ?
User 2: We need to redo the curtains and paint all the walls and ceilings .
User 1: I'm the painter . You can be in charge of going to curtain shops to choose curtains . That will probably be pretty expensive too . Having good curtains made isn't cheap .
User 2: You mean we can't just buy curtains already made ?
User 1: Absolutely not . The windows must be measured , and then the curtains need to be made professionally . So that will take a while . Maybe a month or so .
User 2: While the curtains are being made , I can start having people look at the kitchen . I can't stand that old kitchen . I won't be able to cook there . I don't want to use that electric stove .
User 1: We need to find an interior decorating company to redecorate the kitchen . I believe in Portland there are shops that specialize in kitchen renovation . I will look in the Yellow Pages . I'd like a kitchen mostly in ivory and light green .
User 2: I agree . The colors must be soft and pleasant . You should feel comfortable when you cook our dinners .
User 1: Me ? Cook our dinners ? Hah ! You will be cooking , dear . You will cook .
User 2: No , I don't think so . I'll be too busy having tea in our new tea room .
User 1: Well , I suppose we'll have to hire a cook then . So you won't be able to afford any clothes next year .
User 2: And you'll have to sell your motorcycle . And your cameras . Right ?
User 1: Maybe I'll cook once or twice a week . How is that ?
User 2: Four times might be enough . Not once or twice .

orig:
User 1: Bob ! Your eyes look bloodshot . Did you not sleep well ?
User 2: I had a drop too much last night . I attended a banquet given by a Chinese colleague of mine . And it was startling for me to find that people are forced to drink against their will on a Chinese table .
User 1: You have it right . Alcohol is a medium for communicating emotion in China . Drinking with business partners or would-be friends is a way of solidifying friendship , especially in Northern China .
User 2: I just felt embarrassed if I refused to drink when people toasted to me . But if I keep gulping down one cup after another , I'm afraid I would feel unfit or sick .
User 1: You lose face by refusing to drink , and the host might think you refuse to give him face . The right thing to do seems to be drinking yourself into incoherence until you throw up . This will endear you to your friends .
User 2: A few guys even threw a drunken fit last night , crying hoarsely and bawling whole heaps of nonsense that I never understood .
User 1: Then he must be opening his heart to the friends . In a word , as long as you demonstrate a readiness to drink more in spite of already suffering extreme discomfort , no one will jeer at you .
User 2: I got you . Next time . I'll preface a toast with a statement like ' I can't drink any more ' and then drink anyway .
User 1:

User 2: I had a drop too much last night. I attended a banquet given by a Chinese colleague of mine. And it was startling for me to find that people are forced to drink against their will on a Chinese table.
User 1: You have it right. Alcohol is a medium for communicating emotion in China. Drinking with business partners or would-be friends is a way of solidifying friendship, especially in Northern China.
User 2: I just felt embarrassed if I refused to drink when people toasted to me. But if I keep gulping down one cup after another, I'm afraid I would feel unfit or sick.
User 1: You lose face by refusing to drink, and the host might think you refuse to give him face. The right thing to do seems to be drinking yourself into incoherence until you throw up. This will endear you to your friends.
User 2: A few guys even threw a drunken fit last night, crying hoarsely and bawling whole heaps of nonsense that I never understood.
User 1: Then he must be opening his heart to the friends. In a word, as long as you demonstrate a readiness to drink more in spite of already suffering extreme discomfort, no one will jeer at you.
User 2: I got you. Next time. I'll preface a toast with a statement like 'I can't drink any more' and then drink anyway.

User 1: I think this spring is a good time for us to start looking .
User 2: We should plan to move out of here before July . I'm tired of living in apartments .
User 1: I know , dear . I am too . But we've just been too busy to look for a house .
User 2: We need to find a good realtor .
User 1: Not necessary . If we use a realtor to find a house , it will be more expensive .
User 2: What do you mean ?
User 1: Realtors always get a commission . If the realtor helps us find something , we have to pay him .
User 2: But doesn't a realtor help with the contract ? I thought they take care of all the legal troubles .
User 1: Yes , that's often true . But you have to pay them .
User 2: I still think we should have a realtor . We're new in this country . We don't know all the laws of buying a house . And also , the realtor will inspect the house . He can tell us if the house has any problems .
User 1: Of course we need a house inspector . But we can hire an inspector on our own . As for the legal problems , I have friends . They can help us .
User 2: So how can we find a house if we don't have a realtor ?
User 1: It takes a little more time . We have to check the ads in the paper . Probably also there are special real estate magazines with ads . Then we have to drive to the homes and look at them .
User 2: And doesn't the person selling the house have a realtor ?
User 1: Sometimes they do , sometimes they don't . It's best to find someone who is selling by themselves .
User 2: Why ?
User 1: That is because if the seller has a realtor , their price will be higher . He will have to pay a commission to the realtor .
User 2: Hmm . It all sounds very complicated .
User 1: It is . But buying a house is very important . So it takes time . That's why we haven't done it yet . It's very troublesome .
User 2: I want to look in the papers today . Maybe we can see something we like .
User 1: All right . I'll buy a newspaper when I go to the drugstore .

orig:
User 1: David , I am going for an interview tomorrow . It's an American company . Can you give me an idea of what the interviewer will ask ?
User 2: Well . They may ask you to tell them more about your educational background and your working background .
User 1: But they can see my resume . It's all in there .
User 2: I know , but sometimes interviewers just want to hear you say it . Then you may be asked for your viewpoint on why you feel you are qualified for the job , give them all your qualifications and how you think they will fit the position you are applying for . Questions like what sort of experience do you have and what are your goals ? are closely related to this .
User 1: Ok . What else ?
User 2: They may want to know how the company will benefit and why they should hire you ?
User 1: I see . What about the salary ?
User 2: Hm , they may ask you what kind of salary you have in mind , or simply tell you what the company is offering . I think the latter is more likely for a starting position , especially if you have little experience . And if they are seriously considering hiring you , they will probably want to know when you would be available to start work . And basically , that's about it .
User 1: Ok , thanks , David . You ’ Ve helped me a lot .
User 2: Anytime . Let me know how it works out .

User 2: That ’ s a good idea . I ’ ll look into finding something like that .
