User 1: What is your greatest strength ?
User 2: I think I am very good at planning . I manage my time well so that I can always get things done on time .
User 1: What is your weakness ?
User 2: I always give each job my best efforts , so when others are not pulling their weight , I am frustrated .
User 1: What is your greatest accomplishment ?
User 2: I got the Scientific Research Prize from the Gansu government for my achievements in the Northwest Regional Economy Development Research Project .
User 1: Can you work under pressure ?
User 2: Working under pressure is exciting and challenging . I don ’ t mind . In fact , I am very efficient when certain pressure is exerted on the work .
User 1: What are the problems you have encountered in your job and how do you solve them ?
User 2: There was a time when both the clerical assistant and the secretary resigned at the same time . I then had to handle their work temporarily . The workload was incredibly heavy . So I started to set priorities for the jobs and hired part-time staff to handle routine work . Finally , I managed to keep the operation smooth until we found someone to fill the vacancy .
User 1: How do you deal with those who you think are difficult to work with ?
User 2: I stick to my principles and keep to the rules . Sometimes , they just lack enthusiasm and I get them involved with something constructive . Some of them change their attitude later .
User 1:
content:
User 1: What is your greatest strength?
User 2: I think I am very good at planning. I manage my time well so that I can always get things done on time.
User 1: What is your weakness?
User 2: I always give each job my best efforts, so when others are not pulling their weight, I am frustrated.
User 1: What is your greatest accomplishment?
User 2: I got the Scientific Research Prize from the Gansu government for my achievements in the Northwest Regional Economy Development Research Project.
User 1: Can you work under pressure?
User 2: Working under pressure is exciting and challenging. I don’t mind. In fact, I am very efficient when certain pressure is exerted on the work.
User 1: What are the problems you have encountered in your job and how do you solve them?
User 2: There was a time when both the clerical assistant and the secretary resigned at the same time. I then had to handle their work temporarily. The workload was incredibly heavy. So I started to set priorities for the jobs and hired part-time staff to handle routine work. Finally, I managed to keep the operation smooth until we found someone to fill the vacancy.
User 1: How do you deal with those who you think are difficult to work with?
User 2: I stick to my principles and keep to the rules. Sometimes, they just lack enthusiasm and I get them involved with something constructive. Some of them change their attitude later.

User 1: The tea smells good . What tea is it ?
User 2: It's a special green tea named Longing Tea from Zhejiang province .
User 1: What's special about it except its pleasant smell ?
User 2: You can see that it keeps the original color of the tea leaves very well .
User 1: They must have some special methods to do this during the process .
User 2: Probably . I love green tea . It's one of my daily necessities .
User 1: Then , do you have “ tea time ” every day ? I mean , do you drink tea at a settled time ?
User 2: Not really . But I really love to have after-meal tea .
User 1: What's the advantage about tea ?
User 2: There are a lot of them . In hot or warm days , tea helps to dispel the heat and brings on an instant cool with a feeling of relaxation . Moreover , the tea leaves contain a number of chemicals which are good for people's health .
User 1: Does that mean the stronger the better ?
User 2: No . Constant drinking of over-strong tea would do harm to people's health . So don't make your tea too strong .
User 1: Got it . What's the proper time for tea ?
User 2: It's fine for most time of the day . But don't have tea before bedtime .
User 1: Why ?
User 2: It will give rise to occasional insomnia . OK , let's enjoy the tea before it gets cold .

User 1: Uncle Ben , how did the Forbidden City get this name ?
User 2: Well , in the feudal society , emperors had supreme power , so his residence was certainly a forbidden palace .
User 1: His residence ? You mean the whole palace ?
User 2: Yes . The Forbidden City is divided into two parts . The southern section , or the Outer Court was for the emperor to exercise his power over the nation , and the northern part , or the Inner Court was for his royal family .
User 1: Oh , unbelievable . This was too luxurious .
User 2: Even the whole country belonged to him . That's why he is called the emperor .
User 1: OK , then . I love these unique structured towers with the delicate carvings on them . It's really artistic .
User 2: Yeah , the buildings and designs of the Forbidden City are the peak of Chinese traditional architecture , not only scientific but also suitable for living .
User 1: I agree . It's definitely a product of wisdom . Well , why were those small animal sculptures placed on the tops of the buildings ?
User 2: Some of them are mascots and some are symbols of power .
User 1: Why are there so many yellow things ? Is yellow the lucky color in China ?
User 2: Oh , no . In fact , yellow is the symbol of the royal family .
User 1: Just like the pattern dragon , right ?
User 2: Exactly . Here is the Nine-dragon Screen .
User 1: Oh , it's really fabulous . I wanna take a picture here .
User 2: Sure , this will be a really good picture .
